Reviews.Title: “Huge room!”
Reviews.Author: BoldlyGO
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a long flight from London to a very friendly reception. I asked about upgrading to a waterview but decided it was too expensive. The reception clerk said I was booked for a king which was quite small, and would I like a queen double which was bigger. It really was a large room, two beds and a sofa. It also had two windows and a small balcony at the back from which you could see the water do I was delighted. The service was excellent in the restaurant and bar, and I used the free wi if in the lobby area. I only had breakfast once as a treat, but it is costly so I can recommend Moonpennies ( turn left out the hotel cross at lights and you will see it at next junction ) I didn't like the music in the lifts but that is a personal preference. the pool was very good too. It is very easy for the convention centre and the shops so I would say it's worth it. If you are a Marriott rewards person you currently get half price on entrees. I thought that the level of housekeeping on floor 6 was exceptional .

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for something extra special this isn't it.”
Reviews.Author: Christie F
Reviews.Content: Spent the night last night at the Renaissance Harbourview. The hotel was clean and modern, but we found it to possess few qualities which would elevate it to a 4 star status. Positives Very nice sheets, bed and pillows. Beautiful Avaida products in bathroom. Clean. Location. Negatives Slow check-in. Font desk service was not very helpful or friendly. Room small. Bathtub small. Overall a decent hotel, but with so many wonderful hotels in the city e would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: MrEdnWilbur
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location in Vancouver. I was upgraded to a harbour view room and it was awesome. Right in front me was the float plane dock and I saw planes taking off and landing on the water. It's an experience that I will never forget. I didn't eat in the restaurant because there were so many other options within walking distance. But I did have a drink at the bar where I met a very friendly bartender who helped gave me tips on how and where to navigate around the city. So a big TY to all hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a beautiful and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TexasOutdoorChick
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. I was expecting a non-distinctive, upscale chain hotel property but instead was delighted by how contemporary and attractive the decor is. While not as hip and edgy as W Hotels, the Renaissance Vancouver looks and feels up-to-the-moment. The location at the edge of the harbor provides a beautiful view from the lobby bar and restaurant. And even from my corner city view room, which lacked windows but had a “Juliette” patio accessed by a glass door, I could see the water and mountains. The bathroom was well appointed with granite around the sink and Aveda toiletries; however, it was a small space with barely any counter area for putting your stuff. An especially nice touch is the very relaxing, ethereal music -- like something you might hear during a massage -- that’s always playing in the background in the lobby area and adjacent spaces. Location, too, is an asset. The hotel is two blocks from the convention center (which was relevant for me since I was in Vancouver for a conference there) and an easy walk to other tourist destinations such as the Vancouver Art Gallery and Robson Street. I would definitely stay here again, especially if I could find a great rate on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 1st week in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: My first room was so hot, I had the maintenance man come in and "fix it". Was broke within 10 minutes of him leaving. They finally switched rooms, at this point I was getting frustrated, but the front desk staff were very sympathetic and helpful in making sure that my stay was enjoyable. The room they placed me in was very comfortable, bed was outstanding! More spacious than most guest rooms at hotels! Concierge Level services were fantastic! And can I praise Marriott for spending a little bit more to get HD level television service rather than having HD TVs with standard service!! So many other hotels get the HD TVs and then use Shaw standard service which looks worse on an HD TV!! Thank you Marriott for a great first week!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location...”
Reviews.Author: Ecneret
Reviews.Content: which is within walking distance [3 blocks away] from the Waterfront Station. This is part of the Marriott Hotel chain and love sleeping on their bed which is very important for me - I was able to sleep soundly, undisturbed and not waking up to a sore back! Nothing too spectacular about a hotel room - my friend picked this for it's location and the brand name. My friend had also requested for a room away from the elevator shaft and ice-maker. But to our disappointment our first room was next to the ice-machine, second room was next to the elevator shaft before finally getting a quieter room! Another complaint we had was a noisy fan-heater which we had to shut off when we were sleeping. There are lots of other hotels nearby and around the Waterfront Station and will look into another one before choosing to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: audilim
Reviews.Content: I've been here several times, and it never disappoints. From check-in to check-out, I'm always happy with the experience. They've got a friendly staff, amazing rooms and great location.

Reviews.Title: “definitely NOT my favorite”
Reviews.Author: GaCare
Reviews.Content: I must start out by saying that the staff at this hotel is awesome! The hotel itself is VERY tired and the guest rooms and hallways need desperately to be updated. The very obviously updated lobby and bar area is beautiful. There were long black hairs stuck to the ceiling in the bathroom that remained my entire 6 night stay - and what appeared to be a pubic hair on the side of the bath tub when we checked in (which I removed myself.....ewww) The food in the lounge is pretty good and again, the service outstanding. would not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PNW2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location to Stanley Park, the waterfront and downtown. The room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. We got a good room price using our AAA membership. The buffet breakfast was great. I have no complaints about this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly central and a nice place”
Reviews.Author: reece501
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overall nice....however if you have a higher vehicle or are renting an SUV chances are it wont fit under the low undercover parking and the closest alternative parking is expensive...the rooms are deffinately not sound proof as you can hear the conversation of people in the hallways rooms next to you etc other than this it's a decent place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: littleella
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Priceline after a last minute decision to attend a conference at the Convention Centre. It turned out to be very close...a five minute walk away. Because I wanted to use the weight room (a very nice facility with pool) after a meeting, I got late check out without argument. The room was what one would expect with a 4* rating in Vancouver.. The Internet was expensive and not exactly reliable. It should be free in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, insane Internet prices”
Reviews.Author: wjw0111
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine, nothing special, but nothing wrong either. I would not recommend staying here for business though - unless your company is OK with reimbursing Internet at $15.95 per day! Yikes... Amazing that they charge this for Internet in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL WATER VIEW”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca_Mike
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for business. After an hour wait detained in customs by an inappropriate canadian officer, my room faced the water and truly calmed me down. Great customer service. The only complaint, the elevators are slow. You can walk anywhere, so close to Stanley park and the shops!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but I expected more from a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ben a
Reviews.Content: We (4 adults) stayed here in February 2012. Got a room for less than $100 bucks on priceline which had this listed as a four star hotel. That being the case, I was a bit disappointed. My conclusion is that the location must be worth three points alone. Our room was oblong shaped and facing south (downtown). Overall I thought the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. My only complaint here was that the room was too small for four people. The room was only about 10 feet wide. That being the case it was difficult for more than a couple people to see the TV at the same time unless you were all in the same bed. The hotel does provide parking at a rate of $23/night, however the parking garage has a max height of only 6 feet. This would've been nice to know in advance as we had skis on our roof which had to be removed. I did not eat at the restaurant or use the exercise facility/pool, though these did look nice. The location is great, just two blocks from the convention center and the bay. The service was great and the people were friendly. The common areas were well designed and very clean. Overall a good hotel but more like three stars than four. I would likely not stay here again unless I needed to be close to downtown and got a great deal on a room. If you have to pay full price I would say this hotel is a poor value.

Reviews.Title: “They care and they WOW!”
Reviews.Author: mummybearof3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very fortunate to WIN a one night stay at this hotel. We weren't sure what to expect, maybe a room on the lower floor with no view, or a room on a higher floor with a beautiful view. We didn't know what the customer service aspect would be like either. We are so happy to say that we experienced 'WOW'! We pulled up to the hotel and weren't sure where to park, valet was polite and offered to park our vehicle, or we could park our vehicle ourselves in the underground parkade. We were given very clear directions on how to get into the parkade and up to the lobby reception. Once at reception, we were greeted by Somayeh and Sam. They were both very professional and at the same time, very fun and entertaining. We were told our room was on the highest floor, facing the harbour; we couldn't wait to go and check it out. What a treat to be on the 18th floor and have such a magnificent view of Vancouver harbour. The room was spacious and impeccably clean, super comfy and quiet, even with the patio doors open (so nice to be able to open the windows or a patio door for some fresh air and see the harbour and mountains). We went back out and walked around the city, had dinner close by, then relaxed in our room. The lighting and decor in the room is well done. The room had robes that were oh so very soft. I love a hotel that has soft robes, towels and linens. I think it says a lot about the hotel and that it genuinely cares about your comfort. We ran into housekeeping a few times and they were very friendly and had lovely smiles, so nice to see. The next morning, we had breakfast in the restaurant, P2B, unfortunately this was not good and is our only complaint. The buffet food was cold and dry. However, there was a lot of variety. We didn't find the staff in the restaurant as pleasant or fun as the rest of the hotel. Other than the restaurant, which really is very minor since there are so many other places to dine nearby, this hotel really was BLISS, and we do hope to return again one day soon. And a very special thank you to Wendy Mah, you have a wonderful team who coordinated a magical and memorable stay for us :) THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Vancouver BC”
Reviews.Author: ShoeSister
Reviews.Content: Great View in front of the Pinnacle Marriott!! Walking distance to Stanley Park... Vancouver has a wonderful "Sea Wall" walking path... Beautiful city and Great hotel for the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, comfortable rooms, and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gazpacho16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2007. I had a room with 2 queen beds and a great view of the harbourfront. I could watch the sea planes take-off and land... This was definitely a highlight, and I found it very amusing! The beds and bedding were very comfortable and I truly enjoyed the burger I ordered from room service. The staff is competent and very knowledgeable about the town. The desk agent spoke to me in Portuguese, and was able to provide me with very good input on activities and things to see during my visit. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and I will definitely return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Harbourside Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GRAHAM P
Reviews.Content: Good location Large comfortable rooms Ecellent food Ecellent service

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: risto85
Reviews.Content: Had a room on the 12th floor which was really spacious and modern. The room had a balcony overlooking the bay with the mountains in the background. The view is superb. The location of the hotel is great, service and staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. B2P bistro great view, good service and decent food.”
Reviews.Author: Berkeley604
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on points. Do not get confused with the marriott across the street! The rooms were nice and spacious. The view is gorgeous. If you happen to get a room without a view, check out their restaurant at breakfast. The restaurant is very nice with floor to ceiling glass that brings in lots of naturally light. It is the perfect place to have breakfast before starting a busy day or if you happen to be in this part of downtown on a Sunday morning when most other places are closed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricy”
Reviews.Author: laut0022
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a convention at the Vancouver Convention Centre. Overall, my stay was fine, but considering the cost of the room, I have had better value elsewhere in Vancouver. Pros: -Nice view of the harbor -Clean rooms and lobby -Comfortable bed -Nice workout facility -Aveda toiletries -2-3 block walk to the convention centre -In-room coffee maker Cons: -Cost of in-room wifi (internet access was free in the lobby and I was actually able to carry the signal back to my room (I was never charged a fee :)) -Small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Very good (second) stay at the Harbourside”
Reviews.Author: pandoras_chocolates
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Harbourside; I'd been previously for a conference, when they were undergoing renovations in the lobby. We were staying this time for three nights to visit friends. We came direct from the airport, after flying up from San Francisco, and enjoyed (finally) taking the Skytrain right downtown. It was a short walk from the Waterfront station to the hotel. We had a room on a high floor, with a city view. The room was at the end of a hallway, and had a very interesting shape, with a large window. This meant the room was very bright in the mornings (when it wasn't raining ;-). We had a comfortable king-sized bed. Bathroom was clean and tidy as well. The room itself was extremely comfortable. The $15/day internet fee was pretty rich, but we weren't in the room much, and passed. We also didn't bother with breakfast; there are loads of places near harbourfront in Vancouver. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and professionally, particularly the concierge, who gave us good advice on where to go jogging. The only mild downside we encountered was with the room window: it sounded like it wasn't properly sealed - quite a bit of road noise came through, even though that part of West Hastings isn't terribly busy, and we were on a high floor. It didn't bother us much, though. As I said earlier, this was our second visit, and we would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service”
Reviews.Author: claudia v
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. We had an amazing thing happen to us here... Alex, the concierge was utterly friendly, with a prodigious memory (she remembered our group from 2 years back... imagine! people everyday at all times, and she placed us immediately). While visiting the acquarium, my 5 yr old lost her camera, and was very upset. The next day, we went to Victoria for the day (she booked an amazing tour by ferry and hydroplane) and we left a note asking her if she could call the acquarium to inquire about lost and found. Upon our return, we found out that not only had she asked, she sent a cab to pick up the lost camera, put it in an envelope and had it sent up to our room with her name on it (Little Ms. Duarte) and a smiley face... we were at a loss of words at her amazing courtesy and out of the way service. Needless to say our daughter was thrilled at having found her 1st camera (which Santa had just brought)... We will remember this trip with the wonderful way her camera was found, not as the trip where she lost her camera! Many thanks Alex, you made us very happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: doggone31
Reviews.Content: Room was clean & quiet. Mattress was firm but comfortable/ A/C was easy to use. Room had a small fridge, which was nice. Pool, whirlpool were clean; the well-equipped fitness centre was unusually airy and spacious. Free internet in the lobby. Staff were very pleasant. City view rooms, while pleasant, just look onto the Marriott across the street, so don't expect a sweeping city view. Next door to an Urban Fare supermarket and within easy walking distance of restaurants, shops, transit, Stanley Park, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with the property and the price.”
Reviews.Author: wannabestaff
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for 3 days and thought the property and the service were exceptional for the price. The hotel we usually stay at wasn't available and we found this comparable at a better price so it's thr Renaissance from now on !!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Pizzle01
Reviews.Content: We went to Vancouver for a mini vacation. We stayed here at the Renaissance, and I'm not going to lie, my first impression was that the hotel looked very nice when you walk in. We went up the stairs to the concierge to check in and gave him my name. He couldn't find it, and the first thing he said to us was, "Are you sure you are staying here at this hotel...are you sure it isn't the Marriott across the street?" I was so offended because he was being so condescending! I know Renaissance is part of Marriott, but I also know the difference between the hotels and I am definitely aware of where I booked my stay!!! He finally found our reservation. After we settled in and we headed down to go to dinner, we stopped and asked the same guy if he had any recommendations on where to eat since we were only staying for a couple of nights and wanted to have the best experience we could. (we had to ask him cause there was no one else working there at that time). He didn't even look up from his computer, and said, "there's a lot of places, just go to Robson street." My boyfriend and I both looked at each other and said to him, we will go there, but is there a specific place you can maybe recommend, and he said just go there and I'm sure you will find something. Worst customer service ever! We then proceeded down the stairs to try to find something to eat, and we figured we would try asking the doorman, Hector. I cannot tell you how great and helpful he was! He gave us 5 different recommendations and was super nice about it. He explained how to get to the restaurants and let us know that if we needed anything else he would be happy to help. Now that's what I call customer service! Cesar, who is another person that was working at the concierge was also super nice and helpful. He always had a smile on his face and helped. Honestly, the hotel was in an okay location of downtown. It's a 5 block walk to the main street, but the view of the Harbour is very nice. The rooms are decent, but the customer service really killed it for me. I wouldn't stay here again nor would I recommend it to my friends. Our initial meeting with the guy at the concierge desk really ruined my experience at this hotel. Renaissance hotel is known around the world and I've stayed at this hotel many times in other locations and I've never had this type of experience before.

Reviews.Title: “Great From Check in to Check out”
Reviews.Author: Dflyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights on a weekend trip from Vancouver Island. The whole experience was great from the upgraded harbor view room to the staff. This is the first hotel I have been in that caters to the techno geeks. They had loads of plugs built into the desk for all your techy toys. The room was was large and very clean with all the modern amenities. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1971
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for business. I thought the hotel was very nice. Bed was very comfortable. Gorgeous view of the harbour (what you can see past the towers in front of you anyway) Residential neighbourhood mostly, so quite quiet. Easy to walk to most shopping on Robson and Granville Streets and the liquor store is only a 1/2 block away. Nice to have a glass of wine in my room after work. The heliport is a very short walk. I thought the front door staff on the most part were friendly although a few turned away when I made eye contact to say 'hello'. They have an amazing gym. Really top notch. Gorgeous indoor pool and hot tub too. Only complaint is that there was no signage for the underground parking. Had to go around the block 3 times before I finally found it.

Reviews.Title: “Get a harbor view room”
Reviews.Author: jb645
Reviews.Content: We walked to this hotel after our ride from the sky train from the airport. It was about a less than 10 min walk from the station. The check in desk clerk was friendly and received an upgrade to the harbor view room as my hubby is a Marriott rewards member. It is worth getting the harbor view room. We had a view of the mountains and we can see the little gas station floating on the water. The room was modern, spacious, clean, and comfortable. The concierge lounge was open late Sunday afternoon and we able to take advantage of it. The lounge served delicious hors d'oeuvres, soup, salad, and a variety of cheese and veggies. We went to see the pool and gym. The pool wasn’t anything big but it is a nice amenity to have and the gym was spacious with lots of equipment. There is a restaurant and bar on site but we didn’t try it. There was a long line in the morning but go elsewhere for breakfast. Just two blocks away, there are lots of places advertising full breakfast at cheaper prices and we took advantage of that. There are two computers in the lobby area and the valet guys were helpful in directions and taking care of the luggage. Overall, it was wonderful stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is very nice located”
Reviews.Author: GLORIAGRAZZIOTIN
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Vancouver Harbourside Hotel The hotel is very nice located, near you will find nice restaurants , delis and one Sven eleven. Our room was fine, and great bed 6 lovely pillows. It was quite and cleans room and has a beautiful view of the harbor (though obstructed by an apartment tower). Bathroom is a small but very clean having Aveda products , the shower was hot and amazing. Globe and Mail was provided in the morning. Breakfast buffet was superb - TONS of fresh fruit and anything else you could want. Quite expensive 26 dollars each. Wi-Fi is crazy expensive at $16 per night... not sure why they charge when the Starbucks around the corner is free. The bathroom is a little small for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what I paid”
Reviews.Author: BanSlug
Reviews.Content: I was able to snag our room using Name Your Price on Priceline at a very good price. The hotel is well run and the front desk personnel very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice although, as others have commented, the climate control is odd - an old-fashioned disc style thermostat that we were never sure was actually working. The room was at time somewhat cool (not good in November) when we thought the heat should be on. But we were greeted by a paper in the morning, decent in-room coffee and WiFi in the lobby (with computers in the lobby too, a nice touch). The location is nice for a walk in the newer Coal Harbour area. The walk up to Robson Street is about 5-6 long blocks, which was okay so long as it wasn't raining too hard. Again, complimentary umbrellas at the hotel to use. We also enjoyed the pleasant, if a bit small, hot tub in the pool area. Overall, a nice stay and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good not great”
Reviews.Author: Jonnoh64
Reviews.Content: I often stay here for business as I'm a Marriott Platinum guest and need to keep points up. This hotel is clean a d very well situated in the downtown core. If traveling on a romantic weekend - as another reviewer was - you could do better by staying at an independent niche hotel or go all out for the Four Seasons or try the newly renovated Hotel Georgia which has excellent art deco finishing. The Renaissance has good! Well equipped rooms with desks! Internet and flatscreen TVs. Breakfast buffet is very good with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Sancuary after travel”
Reviews.Author: Trish B
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on points at the very last minute after having travel issues with returning to Calgary from a long trip to Nepal. This place was exactly what we needed - great bed with great linens and 6 lovely pillows. It was quite and clean and we woke up to a beautiful view of the harbour in the morning. Globe and Mail was provided in the morning. Aveda products are provided as well. Nice tea and coffee are also provided. Shower was hot and amazing. Desk and coach provided. They also let us have a late check out - 2 pm. Wifi is crazy expensive at $16 per night... not sure why they charge when the Starbucks around the corner is free. The bathroom is a little small for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large meeting rooms for events”
Reviews.Author: cfilmcat
Reviews.Content: We held several large events here. Nice area in front of the rooms for tea and coffee. Good lunch table service. Their projection system and screen was outdated, dark and soft focus.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lounge”
Reviews.Author: alyandoli
Reviews.Content: Our room was a nice, though the decor was a bit dated. (My favorite feature was a column of shimmery blue tile in the shower. Least favorite - the striped carpet!) No robes or slippers, unfortunately. Breakfast buffet was superb - TONS of fresh fruit and anything else you could want. Quite expensive, especially since parking was almost $30 for one night. Fortunately we could walk everywhere, which was nice. The "Harbourside" is not quite on the water, though it probably wasn't too long ago that it had an unobstructed view...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SkylarC
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Priceline. Location was perfect. Nice wide open lounge with huge windows to see the view and have a few late drinks. The breakfast buffet had everything you could want.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to visit, poor for business”
Reviews.Author: bobsyrunkle
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in a harbour view room. Room was fine (though had to call for a shower curtain), nice view (though obstructed by an apartment tower), and good, but not great location. The aspect that sank the hotel for me was the poor internet connection, both wired and wireless. Have seen the same issue at the Vancouver Airport Marriott: intermittent, very slow connection. It took me hours to synch my email. On that basis alone, I would not recommend this hotel to business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Mobile AC unit in a very expensive room”
Reviews.Author: camihayes
Reviews.Content: VERY expensive. Perhaps the harbour view rooms are better, but our 4th floor "city" view didn't have a view at all. Worst of all, rather than a centralized or even a wall-mounted AC system, we had a portable unit with a giant hose. Limiting access to our small deck, a piece of plexi-glass with a hole in it (for the AC hose) precariously sat between the 2 glass doors. We requested a room change but due to the convention no luck. If it weren't for the hotel cost being covered by the employer, we would have demanded our money back and stayed elsewhere. I've seen better at a Super 8, and Super 8's aren't nearly as expensive. Additional disappointments: Terrible shower and room service food Something positive: The room service staff was extremely professional and courteous. Excellent fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: SherryLinn777
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not good at all. The staff was nice and thats about all I can say. The room was tiny and dark (room 942). The bathroom was a broom closet only one person could fit at a time and if you sat on the toilet you were facing the person on the bed(weird). The bathroom door was a cheap pocket door. The hallways were small and I could touch the ceiling (im 5'6"). We heard loud people in hallway all night. I thought bed was ok but my husband woke up with a sore back. There was a small coffee pot. Honestly we should have said something but we were tired and only staying one night. Never again! The hotel was near empty, thought they would at least give us a decent room so we might come back and pay full price (we bought on priceline as a 4 star). Also they nickel and dime you the parking was $31 and if you wanted to use the wifi it was $16 for one day. I would say this hotel is a 3 star if that. I have stayed at many hotels and this is my first review.

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: ger o
Reviews.Content: the hotel lobby and bar were very nice but the bedrooms on the city side could do with tripleglazing as the noise was unbleivable we might as well have been sleeping on the street! If your looking for peace and quite this is not the hotel to go to,espically when your put into a room next to generaters. linen on the beds should be changed more frequently because there was a stench of them,they could do with whitning powder!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for rooms like that!”
Reviews.Author: Mhcd78
Reviews.Content: When I went for a business trip in Vancouver last July 2011, we opted to stay there since we wanted to make sure it's a decent hotel we were going to stay in. The room i got was designed well but surprisingly, I had no mini bar, though I had an ice bucket (??). Size of the room was enough and I liked the sofa, but my room was overlooking the road and not the harbor. I checked out the room of my colleague and she had a waaay bigger room, with a view, a veranda and a bigger bathroom. When we checked our room bill, we were charged the same rate!! And not just that, I stayed there for 3 days and 3 nights and each room had a total bill of CA$700+! A very expensive for a rather average room. I found out through another colleague that there are other hotels near the shopping street where it's half the price with bigger rooms. So, if I were to go on a business trip again, I'd probably consider this hotel again, but if I were on vacation or just want value for money, I'd check out other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Our room (#433) had a great view!”
Reviews.Author: npm47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Harbourside for two nights until our weekly rental became available. The room we were assigned had a balcony with a tremendous view of the seaplanes and mountains. I imagine if we were a couple rooms to the left or right, our view would have been partially or totally obstructed by high rises. The interior was contemporary with extremely comfortable mattresses. The staff was able to fit a rollaway in the room since teenage siblings aren't keen on sharing a bed. The fitness center was impressive - quite an assortment of equipment and quite large.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: makua
Reviews.Content: We had a great harbor view room during our short stay in Vancouver. It was within walking distance of downtown. PROS: 1. Wonderful view with early check in 2. Ease of navigating the city, dinner reservations 3. The bellman rapid and courteous service 4. The service from the waiter for the wonderful breakfast buffet. CONS: None

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what our family needed”
Reviews.Author: cazaresil
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this property with points (15,000/ night) because any hotel in that part of Vancouver is expensive. We are a family of 4 with kids aged 4 and 2. We got a room with 2 doubles and a small sofa and in addition, we got a rollerway bed delivered to our room at no extra charge. The room wasn't large, but it wasn't small either.... bottom line, we had enough beds to accomodate everybody comfortably and the kids enjoyed playing with the beds. The view towards the harbour and Stanley Park is not unobstructed, but it's nice nonetheless. I did enjoy taking a morning picture of Stanley Park framed in between two high rises. What else is good: location. IMO, sleeping in the Coal Harbour area of Vancouver makes a huge difference. I regard Stanley Park as one of the greatests urban parks in the world, and probably the most beautiful. The pedestrian/ bycicle trail that joins the Canada Place and Stanley Park has to be one of the most pleasant walks anywhere. Another positive was the staff, very helpful. Regarding the previous comments about Internet, parking and breakfast... Internet is free in the lobby, so what's the issue? How many hotels of an equivalent brand name offer Internet for free anywhere in the property? Not many, so I thought this was a nice surprise that added value to my stay. Parking is expensive but if you are trying to save money, keep in mind that street parking in that area of Vancouver is super safe and free during the night. I actually left my car in a Chinatown parking garage (EasyPark close to Main and Keefer) for $10.50/ day during my all-Vancouver days. I picked the car up for our day trip to the Sea-to-Sky highway. Got back around 8pm and paid for two hours of street parking right across the hotel (there is a 2-hr limit so if you need more than 2 hrs you have to be more inventive). Free street parking starts at 9 or 10pm (can't remember). Bottom line, there are ways to save in parking. Yes, breakfast is ridiculously expensive... but... isn't that the case in any property of that level? I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JWK_11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel and found it very nice We have stayed here before and the hotel is certainly a lot better than it used to be The entire staff was very obliging and helpful We had a problem with the safe and after calling ,the repairman was there in 5 minutes which is really great Would definitely recommend the hotel to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stunning view and very professional staff”
Reviews.Author: skinsid
Reviews.Content: Trailfinders booked us here as part of our Canadian tour before joining a cruise to Alaska and we were very pleased they did. From the moment we arrived the staff were extremely professional and helpful. The rooms are of an excellent size and the view of the harbour is stunning. One way from the hotel you are within easy walking distance of the cruise terminal which is just next to Gastown and the other way is a beautiful walk along the waterfront, past the marina and into Stanley Park. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the concierge very knowledgeable and helpful in organising our trip to Grouse Mountain. Thank you for making our stay most enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: scaldar
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from this hotel. It is clean decent but not up to normal Marriott standards. First no valet parking after 11pm. Its $31 dollars to park a night so at the least you would think they would have somebody 24 hours. Pool area is weak and Jacuzzi is a joke. Halls are kind of old. Elevator requires a key to go to your floor but seems to only work half the time. Not sure how many times I went to 19 floor first before I finally got it to allow me to illumenate the 10th floor where I was staying. Expected more for the price but then again Vancouver is a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “wont stay there again, overpriced, small and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Arteleis
Reviews.Content: Although the bed was nice, the 259 dollar room overlooking the harbor was not worth it. There wasn't even a bar fridge in the room, room service was closed at 10:00 and the lounge on a sat nite was closed before midnite. internet was extra, parking extra, breakfast extra, and when i asked to bring a bottle of wine at 10:05 to our room(for our romantic getaway) i was told to head to a pub or 711 if i wanted something else. Transferred us to an overpriced pizza place who took 2 hours to deliver. I was incredibly Disappointed it in this room. For the same price can have penthouse suites in other hotels that have far batter service and decor. Harbor view by the way is DEF not worth it either considering theres a giant chevron oil rig sitting in the middle with horrid bright lights. haha, horrid arts on walls colors are also a lie, pictures on their site did not tell the truth. May as well have stayed at a holiday in on top of a Dennys. Thanks Marriot for rippiing me off. Try the Listel hotel! Actually have taste and fantastic service. Good luck folks.

Reviews.Title: “bright, airy refreshing hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelBid
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room with a balcony overlooking the harbour. it was everything we expected of an upmarket hotel. The gym and indoor pool and spa were great and of high standard. everything was clean and fresh in all areas of the hotel. we were able to use free internet in the lobby where there were 2 permanent computers. The food in the inhouse restaurant was excellent and the service good. we would go back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Traveler_30
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be far above average, and I would be absolutely thrilled to stay here in the future. The room I had was on the 7th floor and faced the harbour. There was a lovely balcony with two chairs that was wonderful for relaxing in the morning with a cup of coffee (which is available in the room). The room was extremely spacious with a very comfortable bed, a chaise lounge, and a desk chair. One thing I loved was the media center on the desk with many outlets to charge all of your electronic devices. The tv was a newer model flat screen of a nice size for the room. I really loved the decor of the hotel. From the outside, it's relatively plain, but once inside you immediately see that the decor is very modern and chic. The hallways are red, and my room had walls of two shades of yellow. The bathroom had yellow walls with black countertops, very sleek. I also enjoyed the modern security feature of the elevator, which required a key card to select your floor when going up. I dined at the hotel restaurant one evening, and I found the food to be excellent and the service to be good. The same menu was available for room service, although I did not use room service during my stay. Each evening I returned to my room to find chocolates on the bed, which I thought was a nice touch. One of my friends returned to her room early one evening. Housekeeping knocked on her door and offered a warm towel along with her chocolates. I was never in my room early enough to benefit from this service, but I thought it was nice also. I was in the hotel for 3 nights, and on the afternoon prior to the last night, I recieved a call from the hotel asking if my stay had been satisfactory and if there was anything else they could have done for me. They truly care about customer satisfaction at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Standard Marriott Fare. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: maslowduke
Reviews.Content: Great location for venturing into downtown Vancouver. Close to the Canada Place and Convention Center Piers - about a 5-10 minute walk. Great views of the harbor, water airport and Stanley Park. The hotel was clean, the service was good and it was a great home base for us. We didn't really take advantage of much in the hotel because of everything offered in downtown Vancouver. One thing I could have done without was the guy who owned the little lobby shop. Every time I went in there he tried to upsell me on something - mostly I just wanted gum or water.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and room with a great view.”
Reviews.Author: seehunt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a Holland America Cruise. The room here was HUGE in comparison to the boat, but it was also on the 14th floor with incredible views of the Harbor, part of Stanley Park, and the Seaplane terminal. Room was clean and comfortable, best bed on the entire trip! Service was also top notch. This place may be in the geographic shadow of the impressive Pinnacle Hotel, but it was top notch in every respect. Friendliest Hotel staff ever for such a large hotel. One small reservation, the lobby is very noisy much of the day and night, and there is no quiet area to use the free Wi-Fi in the lobby and do some work.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Vancouver sight-seeing vacation”
Reviews.Author: GoCoGo
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The outdoor bar/restaurant patio is situated perfectly to watch the float planes take off and land from the bay. I forgot my toothbrush and razor and the front desk sent both up immediately. The concierge's restaurant recommendations were spot on and he/she also gave us great tips for our day trip to Whistler, even recommending sights along the way. The only downsides were the indoor pool ( It was unappealing) and the rooms could use a bit of an update. But the location is perfect for biking/walking Stanley Park, walking to Canada Place, or shopping areas. Car rental directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay except...”
Reviews.Author: asa4598
Reviews.Content: ...for a CAD300++ you do not get a mini bar nor complimentary water bottles in the room. Service was great though, and it's a few blocks from downtown and the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “good top end hotel without the top end price”
Reviews.Author: glenroben
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights and had one of the best beds after a 23 hour trip to relax and get some well earned sleep.The restaurant was excellent with a good quality menu and excellent service and staff, compared to a lot of big brand hotels this represented great value for money for those wanting a 4-5 star hotel.There is a chinese restaurant called the oriental which is located on the corner near a pub only 60 metres from the hotel absolutely brilliant food if you are a chinese food nut like me,...seriously as good as it gets and i have been to most all around the world

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SoCalPals
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of Vancouver's action. In the heart of downtown, it's walking distance from the cruise ship terminal and beautiful Stanley Park. Our room had a great view of the Harbor and the staff was very helpful in making our stay in Vancouver exceptional. This is a great place from which to experience Vancouver before and after an Alaska Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mtemu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights at end of our tour prior to cruise. It is very close to the cruise terminal but not otherwise particularly convenient to tourist attractions or restaurants. It was okay but nothing spectacular certainly think you could do better. Our room was missing a fridge which was supplied on request although it didn't fit the space. As it was on wheels seems this is a common occurence, others in our group had similar problems missing fridge.kettle etc. not all were rectified. If you need more than the miserly drop of milk provided for your tea/coffee provided go down the block to the convenience store don't as one of our group did ask for extra from front desk. $12 + room service charge for a glass of milk! This would be provided free of charge in the cheapest budget hotel in Australia. Obvious this hotel caters more to the business traveller than to tourist trade trendy furniture but not particularly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the experience”
Reviews.Author: GPDScottsdale_Az
Reviews.Content: From our early morning arrival,with our room ready the restaurant and things to do the staff was most helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang37
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Vancouver is an excellent hotel. The service was superb from the time we checked in until the time we checked out. The staff were very helpful, took care of all of our needs promptly. The location is great in the heart of Vancouver only 2 blocks from the harbor. The views from our room were tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in one of the most scenic cities”
Reviews.Author: 1Gman1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Renaissance on a few trips to Vancouver. Service has always been good and the location is a short walk to Robson Street. While I usually avoid hotel restaurants, the food at this and other Renaissance hotels is usually quite good. This must be something this brand focuses on. Bring your jogging shoes and go for a run along the harbour (I have to spell it like the hotel does) and Stanley Park with a nice view of Grouse Mountain. If you really want a good workout, you can walk/jog a 5k or so hiking trail up Grouse Mountain and take the tram back to the base of the mountain.

Reviews.Title: “On the water and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: grahamtrio
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five days in Vancouver, one of North America's must-see cities. We really enjoyed The Renaissance Harbourside as it was easy to get to and from there, easy to get around town. It was a business trip for my husband, but also a chance to visit family. The staff was very accommodating and the service was excellent. The rooms were a nice size and had all of the amenities along with very comfortable beds and linens. We had a room overlooking the water, which was extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: dragonlady1969
Reviews.Content: We happened to be in Vancouver on Canada Day. The Renaissance was perfectly located to experience all the Canada Day events and when it came time for us to leave on our cruise - we walked to the cruise terminal. Staff was very accommodating to our last minute requests.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Petdankay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Renaissance Vancouver Harbourside Hotel for 5 nights and it was a wonderful stay. The food was excellent and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nothing awesome”
Reviews.Author: dbsanders
Reviews.Content: Staying here using Marriott points, so not too aware of the cost. Parking is $30/day but that's expected in downtown hotels. Within walking distance of coffee shops, SkyTrain station, and waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to go back”
Reviews.Author: MySalami
Reviews.Content: Even thought the main structure is not the newest, the main areas and the rooms are nicely renovated; providing plenty of comfort and everything else you'd expect from this category of hotels. Some of the rooms offer a nice view over the harbour, including an interesting view of the seaplane airport operation. Convenient location, halfway between Stanley Park and the city center, almost everything is at walking distance. Very polite and helpful staff. I had a very pleasant stay and i'm looking forward to go back, however, i have to mention a couple of minor remarks: from inside the room, i found the elevators a bit noisy when rumbling up and down, the old air-conditioning pack in the room is definitely too noisy and the Internet rated excessively expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and great location”
Reviews.Author: yaven
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location just a couple of minutes walk from the convention center, and its harbor view rooms look out across the harbour. Our interconnecting rooms were spacious, and the beds were really comfortable. We had a very pleasant dinner one night in the hotel restaurant, and enjoyed the breakfast buffet and coffee machine in the Club lounge. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and we got some great sightseeing advice from the concierge, Alex. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Renaissance - great location and harbor views”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night in June 2011 prior to leaving on a cruise. The club level floors are the 18th and 19th floors, but the club lounge closes at 11am on Friday and doesn't reopen until Sunday at 5pm, so be aware of that if you are staying on a Friday or Saturday night. Since my husband is a platinum member, he talked the desk into giving us coupons to have breakfast in the restaurant since the club lounge was not open while we stayed there. The breakfast in the restaurant was a large buffet with lots of choices including an omelet station. We were in a large room on the 18th floor. We had an enclosed/glassed in balcony with great views of the harbor and float planes. Our room was a typical Marriott room in terms of decoration, but I can't emphasis enough how huge our room was. We spread out all of our luggage and had lots of room to spare. There was also lots of desk/work space. We spent quite a bit of time sitting on the balcony watching the float planes land and take off. There was an in room safe, hair dryer, iron/ironing board, robe, lots of closet space, coffee and tea. The only thing we didn't like was the bathroom was very small, there was not a separate sink and toilet/shower area, and there was no way to lock the bathroom door. There is lots of sitting space in the lobby area just to hang out. There were also two computers with free Internet access in the lobby. It is about a 4-5 block walk (downhill) to the convention center/Canada Place/cruise ship port from the Renaissance hotel. We didn't take a cab, but I suppose you could if you didn't want to walk (you could expect a 2 minute cab ride for about $5). This hotel would have far superior views of the harbor than the Marriott across the street, so if you are deciding between the two hotels, go with the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Noush01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a weekend in June. The staff were very friendly and the room was good (oddly shaped though). My friend would be upset if I didnt mention the parking though. It's hard to see how to exit signs in the parking. They dont have big signs but those small exit signs by stairways!

Reviews.Title: “lobby ok then onwards going downhill”
Reviews.Author: HampshireMax
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. When we checked in we asked if poss for a room with a nice view was told the hotel was pretty full but said he had found us a nice room. If the room we were given was nice I would hate to think what bad was. Dark dingy and a corner window overlooking the back of hotel. We had to permantly have the lights on in this room as hardly any daylight could come into this room. I would say that the hallways to the rooms and the rooms need a lot of updating cheap and tacky is the words i would use to descibe how we felt about this hotel. I would defently not stay in one of these hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: teeDoan
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice enough. Our room was comfortable, clean, and updated. The walls are super thin, and you can hear everything going on in the hallway, but I've found this to be true for many hotels. The location was pretty good. We were a few short blocks away from Robson/Granville and a good walk from Stanley Park. There is free wi-fi and free internet stations in the lobby, which is really nice. There is a daily internet fee, if you want to have access in your room. Parking is $20+ a day, but that is pretty normal for Vancouver. Overall, I liked the Renaissance better than the Sheraton Wall Center and Sutton Place. It's probably on par with the Hyatt, but the Hyatt has a better location (but less comfortable beds).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service and what a view!”
Reviews.Author: MartzBoston
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it was close to the Vancouver Conference Center and the closer conference hotels were fully booked. Boy, did I luck out. The room was spacious, overlooked the harbour--I could see the seaplanes take off and land, there was free wi-fi and the hotel was close to everything. Unlike the conference hotel which was like a big mall, this hotel was smaller and nicer. The staff were terrific and the room was really huge. I could walk to the harbor park in 2 minutes, to the conference center in less than 5 and to Robson street (major shopping) in 5-10. Also, the beds were soooo comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinkerman33
Reviews.Content: Clean, centrally located, walk a few blocks to Olympic center, waterfront, conventions center , sightseeing buses, room view over water was nice.. everthing in Vancouver is a little pricey, but a great city to visit. Staff was friendly and helpful..great fitness center and pool for location... ****If you pay $ 15 a night for internet , you get FREE local calls and calls back to USA.. ( great deal)

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance and Amanda Bye Saved The Day”
Reviews.Author: WallabyD
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Vancouver, one day prior to our cruise departure, it was apparent that the hotel we had booked was not in a good part of town. Desperation set in and we hopped in a cab and headed back downtown to the Renaissance Vancouver Harbourside Hotel. Upon arriving, a young but very Professional and understanding Miss Amanda Bye listened to our plight and got us into an amazing room at a last minute special rate. She was extremely helpful and kind and in a world of not so great customer service, Miss Bye exceeding all of our expectations and turned a very bad first night in Vancouver into a very good one! The rooms and views are breathtaking, looking out over the harbor, the location is perfect, a few blocks from the Waterfront stop from using the SkyTrain from the airport and it's just a one block walk down to the waterfront itself where there is a plethora of restaurants and yummy eats such as gelato. The staff overall are very accommodating and the buffet breakfast is top notch. I would not hesitate staying here again on our next visit and I would hire Miss Bye in a heartbeat if I owned any type of establishment. Thanks again AMANDA!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichardCLT
Reviews.Content: What a rubbish hotel. Its right from the 70's. Rip off parking, bad rooms with old school air con Nice view but thats about it. Staff are icompetant. Did nto deliver my platinum welcome amenity. When I called they accused me of lying. very odd. I will NOT return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCatman
Reviews.Content: In my almost weekly travels I stay at many nice hotels, but not every one distinguishes itself with the superior customer service offered by the front desk staff at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJGIRL
Reviews.Content: It's nothing fancy but it really works as a business hotel. The rooms are fine and if you get one with a view of the lake/mountains, it's much more than fine! If you need to be downtown and/or near the Convention Centre, it's hard to beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great day despite of rainy weather”
Reviews.Author: chr_marotzke
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, Personall is verz friendly. Breakfast was excelent. Champain in our honeymoon escape rate was the way we wanted it, cold and dry. The only thing we did not like was the parking facility. This was quite difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: Tina_Greg44
Reviews.Content: The rooms are good, the service is good, and the prices are reasonable. I decided to choose this hotel following previous reviews on trip advisor, and I wasn't disappointed. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. Vancouver is a really nice city, and this hotel is pretty well located.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but loud party ruined experience”
Reviews.Author: Hedgesa2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance in downtown Vancouver while working a trade show at the Vancouver Convention Center. Overall the rooms were very nice and well appointed and the hotel staff was very friendly. Unfortunately during our stay there was a party for Persian New Year and the vibratiions and noise could be heard throughout the hotel during the night and very early the next morning. Being in the travel industry (I work for a CVB) I understand how much revenue those events provide but what I don't understand is why a more reasonable time limit was not placed on the music. When I brought it up to the hotel staff the next morning they said they had received a number of complaints from guests and were very sorry. Here is an idea to avoid complaints, turn off the music at 12:30. Had the party not been going on I would definitely have reccomended this to other business travelers. I think next time we are in the area however we will stay at another property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MOSANTA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location with very friendly staff. Room service was a bit slow otherwise no complaints. Clean rooms we had a partial view of water and mountains. Clean and beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond the call of duty.”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: I knew that Vancouver wasn't huge, geographically, so I wasn't worried about needing to get to the airport for sidetrips to Calgary, Kelowna and Victoria during my stay. Unfortunately, I hadn't factored in downtown traffic. Because the Harbourside was some distance from the airport, which is actually in Richmond, I found myself at the valet station at 5am three days in a row. The first two days, there was no problem as there was someone on duty each day. The third--a Sunday--a "suit" came to the valet station asking what I wanted. I gave him my parking ticket, and explained that I had to catch a plane. He ran off and drove up in five minutes with my rental car. I offered the gentleman a $10 bill which he declined to accept--explaining to me that he was the manager-on-duty of the Harbourside (Whoa!). I realize this is what five-star service is about, but I still worried about finding my luggage on the sidewalk when I returned to the hotel. I also had faxes placed in envelopes and delivered to my room as soon as they arrived--in one case it was the middle of the night. The night before my day of departure, I explained at the valet station that I had to return my rental car and be through airport security and at my international departure gate at 5:30am. A valet jumped into my rental car and drove me into the underground parking garage. He placed my car near an elevator and gave me my keys. I made my plane with time to spare. I know this sounds like I spent more time *outside* the hotel than *inside* to hotel. But the fact is that without the exceptionally high level of service the Harbourside provided, my visit to Vancouver would have been a complete failure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CDNRower
Reviews.Content: Very nice view from our hotel room afforded us the colors of sunrise set against the majesty of a mountain range to and the goings on of a bustling sailplane business. We are Marriott concierge members so were able to avail ourselves of the 19th floor Concierge Lounge. Very nice hosts up there and when we did dine at the main level buffet it was also pleasant. Room is somewhat dated, but very clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed the complimentary jogging maps -a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Not what Was Advertised”
Reviews.Author: SeattleKiki
Reviews.Content: The Hotel from the outside looked old and Shabby far from the pictures posted on the web site. Check in was not a good experience it was 3 times befor we could get a key card to work to get into the room and on and on. The Restaurant looked nice but did not live up to the expectation.food was not good ,service was slow.20 minutes after coming into the restaurant we actually caught our waiters attention and it was not even that busy. Breakfast buffet was sub standard food was not fresh. Dinner promised to be something nice. It was not it was really just average compared to alot of other places near by this P2B restaurant is poor . Rooms were smaller than we expected .Did not like the dirty bathrooms and garbage in the side drawer made me feel dirty. Parking was excessive Internet was expensive 17 dollars for the day and we wee only on an hour All n all thiss is a low 3 star at best .Go elsewhere for a better experience

Reviews.Title: “Great price, amazing value for money, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: AmitSa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel overall. Secure, very clean, safe and great value for money. I would rate it equivalent to any great hotel in Vanc for much lesser price(Check for promotions) and if you are a regular, they would upgrade you to a harborside. Good resturant, easy access to everywhere, highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising, Dirty & Disorganized”
Reviews.Author: Lisabelle5
Reviews.Content: It is a good thing I booked this hotel through priceline at a discounted rate, the quality and service we received for this hotel was not even on par with a two star hotel. Even with the discount in mind, for what we paid I was still quite disappointed. First of all - this was a weekend girls getaway for two working professional women who wanted to visit the city and pamper ourselves (at least a little bit.) I saw on the website that this property had a pool and jacuzzi open 24 hours as well as a sauna. The Jacuzzi was closed for cleaning, and then was out of order for the entire weekend. We were ok with this as we thought to just use the sauna - There is none! The website falsely advertises this feature (amongst others). I was told by a hotel staff who was laughing that it was "not replaced when the hotel was renovated"..IN 2008!!!!! I don't think it takes 2+ years to change details on the website. There were blood stains on my sheet and the balcony was filthy. I met the housekeeper of our floor and she was so lovely and sweet, the attention to detail of these issues was likely an oversight as the result of being allotted to many rooms to clean. The decor is best described as "confused". It is modern minimalism meets country western/Mediterranean. The hotel doorman was very gracious, the beds were ok and the location was near a skytrain station. These are only the good qualities this hotel has to offer. Like I said. Stay at a two star hotel and save your pennies. Why exactly is this hotel considered a four star luxury hotel anyways? They even charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: keenvisitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights whilst DH attended a meeting. The hotel is very central within easy reach of skytrain, Stanley Park, shops etc.. We had a good sized room with enclosed balcony and a great view of both the bridge and the harbour. Comfortable Marriott beds and bedding. The staff were courteous and efficient (brought luggage rack and chairs for the balcony within minutes) and check-in extremely quick. Some people seemed to have great difficulty with the elevator where you have to insert your room key before you press the floor number, but I think it is a good security feature. Internet access is around $15(+ tax) noon to noon, although it is possible that some room rates include the internet, and the parking is expensive (did not have a car but glanced at the rates) but it always is in big city hotels. The lobby is modern but IMO the rest of the hotel has exceedingly garish carpet and the rooms seem to have been designed by a committee which never met together. Bright striped carpedt competing with elegant navy pin striped bedskirt; Modern dark/light geometric headboard next to blonde wood table: yellow block wallpaper and matching sheers - very 70;s to me. We stayed here as a change from our usual hotel and found it very comfortable, however we will probably revert to our usual hotel next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent - but parking a MASSIVE scam”
Reviews.Author: weddingbelles
Reviews.Content: Really would stay here again were it not for the MASSIVE scam that is the parking situation - they charge like $30 for a "day" - but the "day" concludes at 6am the following morning, then you're charged for another day!!! I nearly paid more for parking than I paid for the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Hotel near downtown”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Hotel has new very modern lobby, I was checked in quickly, but had to ask twice to get a room without an adjoining door. The rooms are updated in modern look with flat-screen TVs, plenty of closet space, and nice work area. The bathrooms are very tiny but the vanity area is large enough to accomodate make-up, hair dryer etc all at the same time. The bathroom is all new and attractive. Just on the small side. If you had two people trying to get ready to go at the same time. It would not be possible to even move around each other. Beds are comfortable--nice linens and comfortable pillows. The restaurant in the lobby is overpriced for the quality of the food.

Reviews.Title: “Only problem is that it's in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: chaub
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel ,very similar to the W hotels. They didn't have my king bed (that I reserved) so they gave me two doubles with a harbor view of the sea planes. Really pretty view. I went during the Vancouver Film Festival, so it was pretty busy. They have a nigh club/lounge area downstairs that seemed to be pretty popular. The parking garage is kind of annoying and can be difficult to find a space, but i've dealt with worse. There's a fantastic dim sum place a few miles away called Kirin (the west one) that was very packed on a saturday morning. Overall I've been to many big cities, and I have to say Vancouver is the busiest and most obnoxious of them all. I will never go back to Vancouver if I can help it. Just a very gloomy, depressing place.

Reviews.Title: “Gala Night”
Reviews.Author: Hamidreza465
Reviews.Content: That was the worst New Year Gala ever...! My girl friend's Jacket and her keys got stolen, we got push several times by crowd and security, the coat check was disaster, people took any jacket they liked...! and then we asked Hotel Rep to get us a Taxi since my girl friend didn't have any coat to wear in -7 dgree outside, which took more than 2hrs to arrive. During this 2hrs we had to seat in the hotel cold lobby where we witnessed several drunk people vomiting and swearing. They didnt even get us a cup of water...! I am pretty sure lots of these guest weren't in age range that was claimed 25M/21F...! "Thank you Renaissance and Icon Nights for ruining our New Year night"

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: YVR-AKI
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at the Renaissance, the preivous time being with an-ex girlfriend the previous year. Both times were great and with a great rate through Priceline. Location is excellent, only a few mins walk from Burrard station skytrain, a bit further from Waterfront station where one can catch the line to Vancouver Airport. Nothing stopping you from coming into Waterfront station from the airport and taking the expo line to Burrard station and walking from there ( or vice-versa when leaving). Taxis are queued out front and it is a short walk to either Robson street or the waterfront if you want to go for a run. Never ate at the restaurants because there are too many great places nearby to eat out or pick up food including Waves Cafe and Urban Fare which are less than a block away. There is also a 7-Eleven and Shoppers Drug Mart nearby for picking up things. Like others have said, the rooms are a bit date with some pretty funky design carpets. But really you can't complain because it is clean and the rooms are spacious. W. Hastings past Burrard street is quite quiet especially at night with the most noise coming from the bar/lounge across the street at the Marriott. Beds are comfy, nice flat screen TVs and Aveda toiletries which the gf really liked. Overall a really great deal especially if you get the priceline rate and a hotel that I will certainly be using again. Only complaints would be the price of the internet access in room and no complimentary water, but then again it is Vancouver and the tap water is great.

Reviews.Title: “Did the Job”
Reviews.Author: DofSales
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here for the night as I was hosting a function in one of their ballrooms. Rooms very pricy. I travel a lot for business, and it seems the more I pay for a room, the less I get. I had to pay for bottled water, (a crazy amount) paid for internet, no newspaper delivery. Room was large, comfortable clean, but you can get this now at many 3 star properties if you look, and they give you the water, internet, paper, parking etc. When in the city, I don't mind paying for parking, it is what it is. as long as it's consistent. Fitness room was nice, well equipped. I had no problems with the hotel, other than I would probably choose to stay elsewhere for less. Please don't get me wrong, great, clean well maintained rooms, I'd recommend the hotel if you don't mind spending top dollar. Me, I'm usually on a budget, spending my companies money, so I look for a bargain, with value and good quality where I can.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars is pushing it”
Reviews.Author: Stev53
Reviews.Content: Older hotel with makeover, No bathrobes, no wine glasses, paper coffee cups, lack of furniture in room, only double beds if wanted a king it would have been $30 more, front desk would "not" compromise, parking advertised at $23 a day but with taxes over $31. We did get a good price booking through the internet but does this mean you should receive less then average service. I will not make this mistake again there are plenty of good hotels in Vancouver that "do" want your business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Views, Restaurant needs some help”
Reviews.Author: JaxxCoach
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and upscale. Views of the harbor were fantastic, close proximity to pubs downtown and other eatery's. Being very close to the conference center was a plus. Restaurant could use some work on the service side but other than that everything was great. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location downtown YVR, older hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: FredShuuz
Reviews.Content: location is awesome if you are at a conference or want to be in downtown Van it is great this is a Renaissance property. like the skydome hotel it was built many years ago - 20? or at least in the style of the 80s/90s i booked this through priceline so value was excellent at priceline price - 85 USD then add tax clean. as clean as other Marriot properties i was at arrived early. they didn't let me check in as the room wasn't available at 11. waited an hour in the lobby with free internet and then checked back at 12, expecting to check my bags with the doormen, but they gave me a room walking in: big room. lots of space. king bed. door opens to a tiny balcony where i could partially see the harbour bathroom was clean. tub. toilet. no rack for hanging your towels to reuse. my room had a little couch. safe in room checkout is at 12. max till 1. wouldn't let me check out at 130. grrr aveda toiletries swimming pool is small as is the weight room but you can get an adequate session in.

Reviews.Title: “Over 100 Nights and wouldn't change a thing”
Reviews.Author: Mik505
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Renaissance in Downtown Vancouver for 40 nights in 2009 and 70 in 2010 (so far). I have come to rely on the consistant quality of this hotel, it's restaurant, lounge, and the nearby facilities. The lobby restaurant is wonderful - though pick the Tenderloin over the Ribeye. Every night there is a 9pm shot from the cannon at Stanley Park to the North. I would recommend walking to the Olympic Torch across the street to get the full effect of the echo.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: dancerLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Marriott Renaissance. Better than Pinnacle. Spacious rooms, lovely views and walks along the seawalk. The concierge, Alexandra Monetta is superb! Anthony at front desk is very helpful and friendly. Loved my stay and will always want to stay here because of the views, the lovely walk along the harbor right outside the doors, the convenience to skytrain taking me everywhere in town and the service of the hotel. Rather expensive buffet breakfast but you can order anything a la cart: lots of wonderful coffee shops including Starbucks one block away and Urban Food, fabulous grocery ,there also.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel with breathtaking views in the center of town”
Reviews.Author: Megan39
Reviews.Content: On the water with a view of the ice capped mountains, walking distance to all the neighborhoods in downtown Vancouver. Modern nicely appointed rooms, and wonderful customer service.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel right on the harbor in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: LansingGayle
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accommodating. The room was exceptional - modern, clean, excellent view of harbor, comfortable bed, coffee/tea in room, 6 blocks from our cruise ship dock, we could walk to everything, excelletn location, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ok but expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: attytrav.
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights for a business conference. My room was large although long and skinny. streetside view. quiet enough and good business set up (lots of plugs, long desk etc) comfortable beds and nice bed linens. small bathroom, thin cheap towels. nicely appointed gym. Desk service was fine. in other words a standard business hotel. I thought that 265 a night plus all the taxes was a lot for the room. however this was my first trip to Vancouver and maybe it is just an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with an excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Dellinda20
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in September and found the hotel to be everything one would expect of a luxury hotel. We had stayed one night last year across the street at the Marriott, equally nice, but decided in returning we wanted to stay at the Renaissance in order to be on the side with a view of the harbor and the mountains. Although the view is between two condo buildings it was still very beautiful, and we enjoyed looking outside and leaving the window open to enjoy the breeze. It is in a good location for walking and taking the bus, and we found the restaurant to be a good place to eat a couple of evenings when we were too tired to walk elsewhere. There are several good breakfast options within walking distance, however, which are much less expensive than the $22+ buffet it offers. It is easily accessible to the waterfront for walking and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “OK room - great food and service”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week and the location was perfect being right near the Congress centre, waterfront and shops. Average room with twin beds instead of a King. At least the beds were large and comfortable with good soundproofed windows. Sleep quality was good although the walls were not quite thick enough to drown out the coughing next door. The food in the restaurant was excellent and I was quite happy to eat there for various lunches and dinner as the menu changed during the day. Staff were always very helpful and efficient. Breakfast buffet had a large range of hot and cold foods and was well worth the cost. Internet service in room was both wired and wifi with good connections. Gym had a good variety of equipment and I did not have to wait for a machine at any time even when htere were a few people in the gym. 4 treadmills, 4 steppers, 4 bikes and various weight machines as well as free weights. Pool & spa looked good but did not try. No minibar in room but there is a shop in the foyer and a vending machine in the gym. Also, a 7-11 just around the corner as well as a Starbucks. Good choice in Vancouver with an easy walk to local shops.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 2 nights. Great service...”
Reviews.Author: sjhanlon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Great service. Check-in was quick and easy. Upgraded to Club Level without asking for being Gold Elite. Club Lounge was nice. Room was clean and had the nice technology panel that Mariott has rolled out. Great location. Walked one block to Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, would not recommend...”
Reviews.Author: mafo_1011
Reviews.Content: I noted that the other reviews on tripadvisor for this hotel were not that good. But I have Marriott rewards points and therefore I decided to stay with points (unfortunately at the Marriott across the street it was not possible to reserve with points at that time). Despite being a good Marriott customer and despite staying for 5 nights in a row they gave me the smallest room on the entire floor just next to the elevator. This seems to be their policy how they treat their best guests if for once they don't pay for the room but use the points they earned during previous stays... not that it mattered a lot because I wasn't in the room very often besides sleeping... but it just shows how much frequent guests are appreciated by Renaissance... Otherwise the room and hotel was ok but nothing special at all. Everything seemed a bit old and a general refurbishment wouldn't harm. Oh n for Internet in the room they wanted to charge 15.95$ per day - only in the lobby it is free. The good thing is, that they don't seem to be tech-savvy: you can take your laptop to the lobby, get a free login there and bring your laptop up to your room again and it is working for free :-)) So overall the stay was ok as I didn't have to pay but I would have been disappointed would I have paid for it.
