After 5 nights I checked out and changed to another downtown hotel: I got a great room with nice views and even a balcony. size was about twice as big, Internet in the room for free and cost at 150$ below any rate you can get at the Renaissance! So unless you have particular reasons to stay there I wouldn't recommend Renaissance at all.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay at the Renaissance in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: finesilver
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights this past week at the Renaissance in Vancouver. Found many things to like, a few challenges. On balance, though, I can recommend. The pluses: -Great location two blocks from the water front, near 20-30 restaurants within walking distance. A few blocks to the convention center where the Olympic torch is located and one more block down is Canada Place. -One of the best hotel restaurants I have been to in a long time, at there three times, all darn good meals. I am submitting a separate review of the restaurant too. -An accommodating staff and management -Well connected and informed concierge staff -wireless internet in the lobby -great door staff The cons: -the decor is a little dated, some of the carpet made me feel like I was in a bowling alley -housekeeping had its challenges, missed cleaning half the room on day, another day left a scrub brush on the floor of the bathroom -cost of $16 per night for internet in the room seems quite high, the trend is free or under $10; I needed the convenience for work so I paid it, still seemed expensive, plus the internet was very slow speedwise -the gift shop was blah, most are, lost opportunities there and lost convenience for gurests -two distinct views one harborside and one cityside, the hotel is quite protective of the rooms with a view, perhaps unnecessarily.

Reviews.Title: “Could use a little attention to the details.”
Reviews.Author: BigTipper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights, midweek. Check-in was smooth and didn't have any issues. They didn't have king size available for me, so I had to take 2 queens. Didn't sleep too well due to 2 issues: 1. I woke up covered in perspiration ( I suspect they use one of those plastic mattress covers, and there is a heavy duvee), 2. pillows aren't as large and firm as I prefer. Desk chair was very poor. Could not lock it upright, and it would not raise as high as I needed to work at the desk. I'm 6 feet tall, but I was still working up at an angle to the desk. Sink/facet combo in bathroom is modern, but facilitates splashing. Had to wipe the counter constantly. Parking level for hotel takes a bit of driving to get to, and out of, but is convenient to the elevator. There is a safe in the room, and there large flat screen is connected to a panel of connectors on the desk, so you can hook-up just about anything to the television, like your computer, DVD player, MP3 player, etc. Patio doors open, but there is no balcony, only a railing. Overall, felt a little dated. Seems like it could use a bit of sprucing-up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a view of Coal Harbor and Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: Foster32
Reviews.Content: The view from our room in the Renaissance overlooked Coal Harbor and Stanley Park. We enjoyed watching the seaplanes take off and the various water traffic. Far off we could see the mountains. Our room had the classic Renaissance features and quality. The breakfast was worth getting up early for. Wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff great location”
Reviews.Author: Ladygolfer31
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8am, following an early morning departure from an Alaskan cruise, given a warm welcome by the receptionist and advised our room was ready. Great to be able to relax for a couple of hours before exploring Vancouver. All the staff very helpful and efficient. An excellent location for downtown Vancouver and the harbour. Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really good place”
Reviews.Author: theriex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after coming off a cruise. Very clean. Comfortable bed. Great transportation, tourist tips and good maps from the service desk and concierge. Breakfast was excellent. No prob storing our bags for the day when we arrived at 7:30am. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: stuawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a hotel in downtown Vancouver for a one night stay prior to an Alaskan cruise. We chose this hotel because of a nice discounted offer. We were shocked when we arrived and saw the room. It felt like being in a matchbox with little room for 2 people to move around. It was sparsely decorated, and the bathroom was a joke. There was not even a hook in the bathroom to hang anything on. The view was of a city building. I went to the front desk, and I requested a different room. I was told there would be no other room available at the price I paid, but I could get another room if I was willing to pay more money. I refused and I decided to tough it out. When using the bathroom, we found that the sink would not drain. I called the front desk, and they said a plumber would be sent up. After we waited 30 minutes, the plumber arrived, and he worked on the sink. He said he could not fix it completely, but he thought it would now drain better. After he left, we discovered, it continued to drain sluggishly. I went to the front desk to request another room, basing my request on a non-working sink and I was once again told there were no rooms available unless I was willing to pay more! I again refused and decided to just deal with it. I am amazed at all the good reviews of this hotel. It appears others had a better experience. In my opinion, the room that we stayed in was not a 4 or 5 star room, but more like a 1 or 2 star room at best. We would have done far better to have stayed at a Motel 6, a Comfort Inn, or a Hampton Inn. At least, we would have had more room, a working sink, and a breakfast. Also, it should be noted that for those with a car, the parking fee is $42 per night! In my opinion, the only thing this hotel has going for it is the nice location. I have a feeling that this hotel has a block of less than adequate, lower end rooms reserved for those who take advantage of a special rate, and once they have you in house, they try to get you to pay more for a decent room. I will avoid the Renaissance brand in the future for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, great staff, great food.”
Reviews.Author: Canadafan2010
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to Canada, last 3 nights spent at Renaissance Harbourside Vancouver. Over the years we have stayed in different hotels in Vancouver and we would say this is our favourite. The Reception Staff were excellent and upgraded us (for a price) to a great room with a view over the water. We could see seaplanes land and take off and lots of boats. All of the staff were polite and genuinely helpful and made our stay very memorable. The breakfasts were great too, although pricey, but lovely food and smoothies. Pool and gym were nice although an outdoor pool would be better but at least there was an outdoor sun deck.We loved it and hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SusanIrvine_Ca
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this Renaissance Hotel on 8/12-8/14. The location of the hotel is great! Walking distance to a lot of places. When we arrived at the hotel and parked our cars on the curbside (loading zone) the attendant (I think they were the bellhop...not sure but he was wearing a tan polo shirt with the hotel logo on it) was quite pushy telling us to go park the car. We were about to unload our luggage. We ignored him, but a few minutes later he again was very pushy about getting our cars out of the curbside telling us we were going to get ticketed. There were 10 of us and my dad had a knee injury so he couldn't be rushed. I didn't know why the guy (he was the older one) was so pushy. Thank goodness the front desk was very pleasant and helpful to make up for the guy outside. The rooms weren't that big. They had Aveda products which was nice. There is a lot of construction going on in downtown Vancouver so the last morning we woke up early to a lot of noise. There are 2 computers in the small lobby, but they are SO slow. We got a great deal on Priceline. I would not stay here for hotel website price. There is a small indoor pool and exercise room. I would only recommend this hotel if you get a great deal through Priceline or Expedia etc. I must say Vancouver is one of the cleanest cities I've ever been to!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice........”
Reviews.Author: nulung95
Reviews.Content: I spent the 4th of July weekend with my husband and we had a marvelous time. The room package came with a free companion ticket and free hot breakfast. We arrived late and had dinner at the restaurant, the server was very friendly and attentive to my special needs ( I try to avoid too much sodium when traveling).... The Halibut dinner was excellent and my husband ordered the filet....delicious!! The room initial room was very small, but I realized we were in Canada, but they promptly upgraded us to a harborview room so the large patio window made all the difference...although no chairs available to sit on the balcony..... I would definitely come back when visiting Vancouver again....

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheMcGovernFamily
Reviews.Content: We had a really great stay at this smart hotel. Everything was as it should be and the standards were high. Staff very attentive. There was some music noise due to a Prom Night (it was a Saturday), which was just one of those things but regrettable, but guess what, they reimbursed my points to me. Thought the staff were really excellent. Try for a room above the 11th floor with a harbour view. If you have kids, there is a good food court beside Tim Horten's five minues away beside the cruise terminal. Tip: walk towards Stanley Park and you will see bicycle rentals. A cycle around the park with kids is just superb!

Reviews.Title: “High-priced average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rumples
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at an excellent price secured via a bid on Priceline. It was good value at that price but definitely would not be good value at the rack rate. Our 12th-floor standard double room had been remodeled but the furniture seemed low quality with knicks and scratches already marring surfaces. The new carpeting (stripes in bold colors that proved a distraction in the room) was already rather grungy. The room was good-size, though, and had a comfortable bed. The small bathroom was adequate and had Aveda products. There was a limited view of the harbor, which was pleasant to look out on, from the corner window. Our room was quite a ways from the elevator, which meant that I saw far more of the hallway carpeting than I wanted to see. The pattern -- two geometric designs featuring primary colors -- had a dizzying effect on me. This decor (and that within the room) is not what one usually encounters in a 4-star hotel. The hotel advertises a $23 daily parking rate. With tax, that actually comes to a daily rate of $31 plus some change. We thought that a bit steep so parked our car in a nearby Easy lot, where the cost is only $6 from 6 p.m. until 6 a.m. At 10 p.m., we moved the car to a parking meter across from the hotel. Meters only charge between 9 a.m. and 10 p.m. We checked out just before 9 a.m. so had no further parking fees, though the hotel tried to bill us for using its parking facility even though we never did use it. We finally managed to get that charge removed from our bill. Vancouver has many fine 4-star hotels. If you plan to pay the regular rate, I suggest looking elsewhere for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbour views”
Reviews.Author: SimonFlyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel has clearly been remodelled and the strange shaped hallways betray its age. However, the rooms are spacious and well decorated. A new apartment building obscures some of the view but there is still a fantastic view of the harbour from the north facing rooms. The executive lounge breakfast is excellent. The lobby is a bit noisy and always busy as the bar/restaurant is part of the reception area. Walking distance to all major downtown attractions. Beware that some rooms near the airconditioning unit can be very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location, way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Summit_Seeker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend getaway with my wife. The rooms are small (for a "4 star" hotel at least) but clean. Very quiet for an inner city hotel, double windows keep out the noise. The free gym and pool are nice perks. No real complaints about the facilities, just the price/rating. I booked through Priceline and snagged a room for $85. After winning I went to the hotel's website and checked what the regular rate is- about $280! So I thought I hit the jackpot by getting it for $85. When we arrived and I saw the room, it was much closer to a 3 or 3.5 star, $150-$180 a night hotel. So I was still happy with my rate, but this is not a 4 star hotel by any means and it kinda put a damper on the weekend. If you stay here DO NOT pay retail price or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor view room made the trip”
Reviews.Author: luxurylady99
Reviews.Content: We went through Priceline and got a great deal. When we showed up, there was a problem with our reservation, but with patience on our part, it was resolved. I think dealing with the staff nicely led us to being assigned a room that overlooked the Harbor. It was beautiful. It was on a lower floor, however, so once the planes started up---pretty early in the morning---we could hear them. But once you were ready to get up, watching them take off and land on the water was awesome. They sort of nickle and dime you here. We wanted wine glasses in the room, and they charged us $5 for them. And if we didn't have such a great room, I wouldn't have been as happy with this hotel. The hallways were fairly beat up, but the rooms were brand new--this was pre-Olympics, it looked like the whole place was due for a makeover. This place was a zoo on Sunday with a whole slew of people staying here on pre-cruise reservations through a cruise company. The lobby becomes a disaster, with everyone downstairs with their luggage. Just know getting your car will take a long time. Not as nice as the Marriott Pinnacle across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay during the Olympics”
Reviews.Author: ladyswiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Winter Olympics for work purposes (designated Olympic Family Hotel). Everyone we met was really friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough to make our stay as pleasant as possible. My room had a great view of the harbour and the Olympic cauldron. Loved having the sliding door open to get fresh air but it was a bit too noisy to sleep with the door open. The air con was a bit noisy too. The minibar (empty!) got unplugged on the first day as it also whirred pretty loudly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, initally a little biased but corrected.”
Reviews.Author: tennisbummer
Reviews.Content: Booked a great rate through one of the bidding services. When we arrived, they initially gave us a room directly above a band playing for a special event, right next to the swimming pool entrance - however, when we complained, we were promptly given a room higher up. Excellent attitude by the staff, good amenities (pool, workout facility, restaurant, and parking on the premises), and a clean room all added up to a great stay. Could walk to Robson Street. Wish they had a fan in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: wucie
Reviews.Content: We booked a double bed/harbour view room at this hotel through our Visa reward program. The location was good and check-in was fast. Too fast it turned out because when we reached our room it was facing the city. Back at reception, the employee responsible for issuing the room was apologetic, but her colleague was cold and a touch rude. Our second try revealed a room with a harbour view (and even a balcony).... and twin beds. This time we phoned reception and asked for another room. Meanwhile we kept crossing our bags which where being trolleyed about one step (or rather several floors) behind us. On our third try we finally got the room we'd asked for (though this one had no balcony and was strangely elongated due to the building's weird shape). The bathroom was small but well appointed and clean, and the rest of the room was equally spotless and tastefully done. We found the insulation to be good (there were even two sets of windows) and the bed was very, very large and comfortable, so we both slept well. The hotel is centrally located and not too far from public transport (though a bit far to walk with 4 large bags + 2 carry ons to the Canada Line or Sky Train) and overall the staff were pleasant and friendly (with the exception of the receptionist and one concierge). I'd probably stay here again, though I prefer the downtown Fairmont with its great location, lavish rooms and customer pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and service.”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaandMelissa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a quick weekend getaway. Considering the great deal we got through Priceline, the hotel was excellent. We arrived three hours early, and when I asked them if they could check our baggage in so we could tour around Vancouver, they did us one better and got us room without delay. The common areas were very clean and well-appointed. Where the hotel loses clout with me is in the size of the rooms. For a four-star, it seemed the rooms were very small, and the bathroom was downright claustrophobic. The bed was very comfortable, though, and television programming was plentiful (which was nice when we were taking a break from walking around town). In-room coffee was very good. If you want Internet, it is nearly $16 CAD per day! Which was tough, because I had to do some work. To summarize, though, the hotel was excellent for the Priceline bid we put in. I would have been less thrilled if we paid the off-the-rack rate of $170-200, given how small the rooms are.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: spinach15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Got a great deal on priceline. The hotel itself was very nice, clean and the people were very helpful. The city view room was clean and we got early check-in available because we arrived in the morning at the airport and I called in to ask for it. They were very nice to accommodate. Its in a great area, about a 10 min walk to the closest train station and/or to Robson street. Great view of the water if you're eating at the restaurant. The only slight negative is that the bathroom, didn't have a lock or a proper door. It was like a sliding closet door.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: MAXII
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant and helpful check-in. We had the room via Priceline but there were no knowing looks or comments we sometimes get when we have booked using the P/Line bidding system. We had a beautiful 16th floor room facing the front of the hotel. Window opened okay and there was very little noise from the street. Well appointed room, complete with safe. One thing we did notice was that there was only one bath/handtowel/facecloth per person. Not a big deal as I am sure we could have had extra if we had asked for them and they were very good quality anyway. Bed very comfortable. Room very quiet even though it was an adjoining room and one of the nights there were people in the other room but hardly noticeable. Just as we got to the room there was an emergency announcement over intercom made by the duty Manager advising us not to use elevators and that we would be advised accordingly. Little nerve racking as we were up on the 16th floor and then the emergency vehicles arrived. However, Duty Manager made at least two more announcements keeping us apprised which was reassuring. It was a false alarm but all the staff we very reassuring and helpful. Hotel itself is beautiful very spacey, clean and all staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Great deal for drinking at the hotel itself as there is a different beer and wine special of $5 each every day. Also, free computer use is available in the lobby. Location was perfect, especially if you don't have your own transport. Hotel is within walking distance to buses, cafés, restaurants and all the local attractions. We even walked to Granville Island and though it is a good walk we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “too bad about the soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Tony506
Reviews.Content: This hotel bills itself as a 4 (and sometimes 5) star hotel depending on which website you explore. In short, while decently renovated with good cosmetics, all the renos in the world can't compensate for a complete lack of soundproofing. We thought the lobby was adequate, the decor interesting although not opulent. Our kingsized room was sparkling clean and had a very comfortable bed. The bathroom door was an odd sliding arrangement designed to minimize door swing and thus allow a king sized bed into a smallish room. That's where the good news ends. The bathroom door affords no sound privacy which could be an issue for friends sharing a room. A bigger problem is that hallway noise transmits so directly through the main door that you would think the people in the hall were standing in the room with you. Between rooms, conversations can easily be heard and we were blessed by next door neighbours who let their baby (after waking crying at 6 am as babies do) bang on a recycling bin or something for the next 30 minutes at 6:30 in the morning. This was not a muted sound. While the drumming stopped the baby's crying, it started ours! Other friends stayed here and commented independently on the same problem with noise and they had a problem with their neighbours leaving the bathroom fan on all night ((presumably to drown out hallway noise?) . Bar food and drinks are expensive relatively speaking, and service while friendly was very slow. However, our friends had dinner in the restuarant (we did not) and said the food was terrific and good value for top dollar. We thought the continental breakfast was good quality although toward the top end of expense.Service was better at breakfast, speed wise. You cannot beat the location of this hotel for easy access to shopping and an inexpensive cab ride to good restaurants and thus my recommendation at all, but the noise thing really is a large problem. If you drive, take the valet parking at 40 dollars a day because finding your way to the self park for 30 dollars a day (OK, 27ish) is a challenge that you don't want to repeat in a city you don't know. I would rate this hotel as a 3 star at most largely because of the noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Dogswood
Reviews.Content: We recently had to spend a night in Vancouver because of an early flight out of YVR. We found that it was cheaper staying in downtown Vancouver at a quality hotel than by the airport. Because the new Canada Line runs from downtown to the airport in less than 30 minutes for only $2.50 after 6 and weekends, it's actually easier than waiting for airport hotel shuttles. We paid $70 a night on Priceline for the Renaissance and was pleasantly surprised by the experience. We were there during the last weekend of the Paralympics and yet check-in was quick and the room assigned was roomy and comfortable. Unfortunately, I am a light sleeper and the first room was on a floor with noisy young people running between rooms. However, we quickly got another room without any argument and were told that if we were not happy with it, they would find us a room that would make us happy. It turns out that the second room was behind the elevator shaft so.....we were cheerfully given a third room. Luckily, the third room was quiet and comfortable. Five stars for the front-desk's cheerful and "make-right" attitude. Other so-called 4 star hotels should learn from this attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a priceline win!”
Reviews.Author: Velvalee
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel for the first time on a priceline bid, and it was pretty much exactly what I expected based on the reviews here. We got a 12th floor city-view room for $70 on priceline, and since the Vancouver Paralympic Games were just wrapping up that weekend, we thought it was a good deal given the location, etc. It is right across the street from the Marriott, and a block from the waterfront. Check-in was swift, and they took my Marriott card for points against any "extras" (no points on hotel rate, of course, since thru priceline). The staff was very polite and professional and made sure no one waited long. The lobby is quite modern and elegant, and previous hints about capturing the free wi-fi in the lobby were accurate; we were able to use it subsequently in our room, though we only tried it once very briefly, to see if it would really work. Simply boot up your laptop in the lobby and sign on to the free lobby wi-fi. A password is provided for accessing it again later, although my machine didn't ask for it when we got up to the room--it just connected directly. It's for reasons like this I don't understand why free wi-fi is not just as ubiquitous as free toiletries and coffee... Self-parking was $29 per day with taxes, and the hotel staff were unhelpful about options for parking nearby. Understandable, I suppose, so do your own research in advance if driving. I read of a $6/day lot nearby in another TA review, but we found no such deal. The room we were given was a double (2 beds), and if not exactly small, it was definitely on the "trim" side. Perfectly fine for a couple or pair of friends traveling together, but I would not recommend this room size for a family (unless it was with a single infant). The beds were nicely made up with quality linens and pillows, and while the mattresses were just a bit firm for my taste, my partner (as usual) loved them! I appreciated the mix of foam and down pillows and the lofty comforters. There is a single nightstand between the two beds, which is a bit inconvenient for us, as we had to share a lamp and the electrical outlet for our accoutrements, but I travel with a Belkin Mini (thanks CdnTravelWriter) travel plug which has come in infinitely handy for these situations! Also, the room had a lovely chaise next to the ceiling-to-floor windows, which made quite a comfy reading nook in the mornings. Also, these windows are actually sliding-glass doors that open to a small...well, it's not exactly a balcony, but you can step out between the windows to a railing...I think it might be called a "juliette balcony". There are no smoking stickers on the doors, of course, as it is a non-smoking hotel, but I saw people dangling cigarettes above and below on more than one occasion. Even 12 floors up, the noise from the streets is noticeable with the door open, but the chance for fresh air is a nice plus. The room does have A/C, however, and it seemed to work quite well. The room's decor is a bit on the bland side and seems a little mismatched, although everything was perfectly clean and in good condition. There is a large radio alarm clock, though not the iPod kind which most 4* hotels provide these days. However, props for the "coffee and tea" box, which was amply stocked with 2 different kinds of tea, regular and decaf coffees, liquid non-dairy creamer, and a variety of sweetners. These are replenished daily and do not come in those ridiculous pre-packed packets, so you can have as many or few condiments in your coffee/tea as you like. I also appreciated that the tiny one-cup-at-a-time coffee maker is one of those newer models where the coffee packet is actually the tray that you slide in for the water to brew through--much less chance of finding a grimy machine or moldy old grounds left in it! The bathroom was on the narrow side, but with plenty of counter space and--much appreciated by the female traveler!--with a mounted, move-able, make-up mirror. Too many newer hotels are dispensing with this luxury, and I mourn the loss! The linens were well-stocked, and while the toiletries were on the sparse side--shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soap--they are Aveda's Rosemary-Mint, which my partner and I both like the scent of! Also, the shower curtain is on a curved rod, and the tub was what I consider slightly wider than standard, so despite the narrowness of the room itself, the shower did not feel in the least cramped. Plenty of water pressure and hot water, at least at 12 floors up. There was a sliding door closet (the bathroom door was a sliding pocket door) and this design kept the small entryway clear of annoying door jams (get it? lol!). The closet held no robes, but did have an in-room safe big enough for a laptop, plenty of hangars (for us, anyway), an iron and ironing board, and a suitcase stand. The bureau, more functional than attractive IMHO, held a large flat screen TV (I want to say 32"?), six large, deep drawers for unpacking, and a desk at the opposite end, equipped with a business console--extra plugs, etc. A nice desk chair was also provided. As mentioned by previous posters, noise is in the hallways--particularly by the cleaning staff--is both noticeable and prevalent. The room's door is clearly not sealed--with the lights off, you can see a good inch of hallway light beneath the door, and probably a half-inch around the sides and top. I don't really understand why the hotel wouldn't invest in a bit of stripping around the doors to seal them and block some of the hallway noise, because it would surely make a difference. Also, as reported here on TA, the cleaning staff apparently makes a habit of knocking lightly on all guest doors between 8-8:30 am (at least on the weekends), regardless of whether your "Marinating" sign is out. We forgot ours our the first night and were woken by knocking at 8:15; the next night we put out our sign and the knocking came at 8:30. They knock lightly--by no means a pounding-- and move on, but I find most people sleeping in a hotel room will react to a knock on their door, no matter how light! And the staff ensure you don't drift back to sleep by making an astonishing amount of noise as they clean the rooms around you--toilet lids are slammed down, closet doors slammed open and closed, hotel doors knocked against walls, trash buckets rattled against the side of the cart...it's very obvious that the intent is to wake guests and move them along in their day so that the staff can get into the rooms and clean them. I can see the strategy, but if I were trying to have a late, leisurely morning, it would be annoying. However, the cleaning woman we met was very polite and friendly, asking when would we like our rooms to be ready, etc. and she did an excellent job of cleaning and straightening the room. She was generous with replacement items (even 4* hotels are getting stingy about replacement supplies these days!). We did not try the restaurant, room service, or use the pool or business center. I will post room photos when I remember to download them off the camera. All in all, I felt the quality of the hotel for the price we paid was fair, although we've won hotels on priceline with a little more of a 4*-feel in this same price range. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the staff is polite and performance-based, and the location is excellent if you are focused on downtown activities. However, I would not rate this hotel in exactly the same category as the Fairmont or Four Seasons, which priceline does. In fact, of the 4* hotels we've won in Vancouver (we've done this 7 times now), this property was probably our least favorite--not because it's not nice or comfortable, etc, but let's face it--staying at the Sutton is not the same experience as staying here, by a long shot! But that is really a priceline issue, so I won't belabor it. I would recommend this hotel as part of an $80-or-less 4* bid on priceline; I would not recommend it to anyone who specifically wants to book a 4* hotel in Vancouver at the regular rate, as there are better values at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Olympic stay enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: ajgeb
Reviews.Content: I and a friend stayed at this hotel for the first 11 days of the 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympic Games. It is not possible to discuss value and/or price, because these are always way different during the Olympics in any city. However, what I anticipated to be a 3-1/2 to 4 star hotel was surprisingly comfortable, with overall pleasant and excellent service, and all that during the most frenetic time any city is likely to see. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was cleaned and straightened at least twice a day, and if we happened to be in the room, housekeeping made it a point to return later. The room was satisfactory for its purpose. In what was supposed to be a twin bedded room, the beds were actually larger doubles, making sleeping that much easier. Although the bathroom was small, it was evident that it had recently been refurbished. The furnishings were new, but fairly plain. We heard no noise from next door, or the hallway, and often slept with the window open to cool off the room (it was overall quite warm in Vancouver, and Canadians seem to crank the heat up more than we do at home). The hotel restaurant was surprisingly good, with an excellent buffet breakfast and a couple of dinners that were, once again, surprisingly good with fine service. I read many posts on Trip Advisor with respect to this hotel, and not all were positive, so I was somewhat concerned about our stay. But all in all, it turned out to be quite pleasant and satisfactory during what must be the busiest time ever for any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: Goulz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Harbourside for three nights. I had a 15th-floor room with one king bed. Room had lots of space, with a couch and plenty of storage. Great showerhead. Had buffet breakfast. Eggs benedict were delicious, along with waffles and french toast. Service was excellent, and housekeeping was very efficient. Only bad note goes to the fire alarm with went off two nights in a row, making the elevators work on and off.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sir67
Reviews.Content: The room was very nicely appointed. The King bed and eight pillows were very comfortable. The large LCD TV was nice to watch. But by far the best part of the room was the harbour view. By all means, if you stay here, get a room 11th floor or higher with a harbour view. The balcony with glass exterior was roomy enough to sit on and enjoy the evening. A lounge and restaurant on the lobby floor serve food and drinks, however all I tried there were the drinks and some bar food. All of it good if just a tiny bit on the pricey side. All of the staff took genuine interest in helping.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a few minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: HelloFromSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over American Thanksgiving after getting an excellent price on a room. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and useful, recommending a great Sushi place in the neighborhood. The rooms were clean and the fitness center/pool area was quite nice. The only downside of this hotel was the agressive cleaning staff. They started coming by around 8am, and either knocked on the door, or in a couple of cases just walked right in while we were in the room. Nothing that the door lock and Do Not Disturb sign couldn't fix, but slightly annoying none the less. Parking cost about $23CAD/day if I recall correctly, and the lot itself seemed a bit dodgy, but we didn't have any security issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great price on priceline, 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Bobbob999
Reviews.Content: Overall I was quite impressed with this hotel, especially for the incredible priceline rate. In my opinion, this is a flat 4 star hotel. It's funny, when I read these reviews before staying in a hotel, I find I'm looking for things. There were a few things I did notice that could have been better, but they would not impact my choice to stay at the hotel again. For example, yes, the windows, doors, and walls seem thin, in other words you can hear sounds from the hall, and the street. Internet is not free, yes, you have to pay, oh well, I paid less than half the rack rate for the room. The parking, it is NOT hard to self park, why not save the $6.00 per night and self park it. The lot is next to the elevator, very easy and worth the savings. I was over charged for internet, but they fixed it right away, not sure what happened there. Ok, one thing that I did find strange. The maid, came in my room with a very quick knock at 4pm on two consecutive days. The second time she just looked at me and said, is everything ok.... umm ya, why are you in here. I probably should have reported this, but I tend to look for the good in people, hopefully it was a mistake. The room was already clean by the way. Anyway. Great deals i n the restaurant, clean, attractive looking lobby, great beds, great location... come on people, walk two blocks and you're in the hear of it. And you get the waterfront as well. Location is perfect. I would stay at this place again, but would liekly look elsewhere if I had the pay $200 plus a night. G

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: LaursieBug
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with our 2 year old. We booked through priceline and got a fabulous rate, and ended up with a king harborview room. We were impressed with everything about the hotel, except the noise from next door. We could hear every conversation taking place in our neighbors room, which kept us up half the night. Otherwise, we couldn't have asked for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: seattledaisy73
Reviews.Content: While this location is a little off the path of the hustle and bustle of the city, it was a great place to stay for the weekend. The beds are amazingly comfy and the staff was very pleasant. The views are great both of the city and the harbor. It was a little bit of a walk to Robson and the shopping district, but overall I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sisabell
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed here this year, always after winning a 4 star downtown Vancouver bid on Priceline. This hotel is very clean, and provides a good basic room. The bathroom has some nice touches like the curved shower rod, and the linens on the bed are excellent. I would say the only downfall would be the price of the wifi (15 per day) and the parking (23 per day), although these are pretty standard across downtown Vancouver hotels. The location is excellent, and the staff were friendly and efficient. Pass on the restaurant and room service... highly overpiced for what you get... there are so many good restaurants in Vancouver I wouldn't waste my time again at this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view”
Reviews.Author: ellenStateCollege_Pa
Reviews.Content: Had a short layover in Vancouver but did not want to stay by airport, took Skytrain, Canada line from YVR to Waterfront stop then 6 blocks to Hotel. Would recommend the Skytrain, $2.50 cents, easy and quick. Less than 30 minutes. Hotel is close to everything with nice views of Harbor. Club Floor was great. Room on 17th floor, faced harbor w/ small balcony area...odd just opened up to outside area w/ another window, can't sit out there. Room was spacious, clean and looks renovated. Club lounge faced city, nice offerings. Had dinner in restaurant facing harbor, safe bet when traveling alone. Served fry bread and homeade tomato jam and gave you recipe, nice touch. Great drinks and food, good price. Staff very helpful. Have to go up some steps to lobby from street, hard w/ bags but staff were quick to take bag up for you w/out asking. Excellent place to stay in my opinion. Free internet access in Club lounge was great b/c I didn't take my laptop w/me.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtvler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline for $64 a night. What a great deal! The hotel appears to be recently renovated and everything worked out well. I saw that some people were complaining about the cost of parking or the internet, but if they had a clue about anything, they would know that all of the comparable hotels in Vancouver charge the same prices. (Hyatt, Delta, Marriott, Sheraton) and I have stayed at all of them. This hotel is right there in the same class. My complaint would be that the hot tub is tiny, there was a family in there so we went back to our room watched a movie instead. The gym was big though. Also there was an alarm that went off in one of the rooms for 45mins, we called down and someone came up to switch it off within 5minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great views”
Reviews.Author: bliss24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference. We had a harbourside room, and the view was breathtaking. The room is very clean, comfortable and modern. The fitness facilities are great too, very well equipped, and little touches like fresh fruit in the fitness center are the kind of attention to detail that make a hotel stand out.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view, great hotel in downtown vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 3ecrm
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Vancouver Harborside is a great hotel for stay in this dynamic city, 2 blocks away from shopping, restaurants, museums and the harbor. This is our 2nd time staying at this hotel, both times, we got a harbor view room on upper floors on the corner, the view is simply gorgeous. The hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful with suggestions on sightseeing, restaurants and cultural events. It is a pity though that more and more of the views are obstructed by the high rising condos between the hotel and the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views, Exceptional Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jakelee
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance was amazing. Gorgeous views if you're facing the harbour and up high enough. The staff was incredibly friendly and took care of our needs. You can tell the building is a bit older, but it's still quite nice. The parking garage is sketchy, smelly and confusing to navigate. If you've got the money, just avoid self-park and valet it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: PhiPsi32
Reviews.Content: The accommodation is very good, but you're paying for it. Even with the group rate I paid $190 (CAN) plus room tax and VAT. However, I had a very nice harbor view. In room internet is $16 a day for 12pm-12pm access (not even consecutive 24hrs). There are two computers in the lobby with free internet for guest use. There are a few coffee shops and one restaurant nearby with free WiFi (if you have a laptop computer). Otherwise, the rooms are spacious and well furnished. The staff is very helpful and can provide good info for first time visitors. There is a very nice upscale market roughly one block west of the hotel called "Urban Fare". It's a good place to buy drinks and snacks for your room and also a pleasant venue for a casual lunch. There are several cafes and pubs within walking distance. Two blocks east on Hastings, you'll find the Elephant and Castle pub which shows Setanta Sports (for the European football fans). There is ample food, drink, and shopping within walking distance. Check out the travel guide provided in each room. At around $200 a night, free internet would be a welcome perk. Otherwise, this is a great place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Service was Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: We came to Vancouver to celebrate my birthday with our 3 children. In the beginning, not everything went smoothly. The person checking us in wasn't very personable. I'm a Marriott Platinum and he didn't acknowledge that. However, when I let the front desk manager know the feedback, they were very appreciative and sincere. The next thing was that my wife took the kids to the executive lounge for some breakfast. There she was not treated very warmly and was in fact scolded by the associate for allowing our 4 year old to stand with our 13 year old as my 13 year old served herself some breakfast. Again, I called the manager, and they were very sincere and apologetic. I always appreciate sincerity. After that, service kept getting better and better. We went to the executive lounge after a day of sightseeing and we brought a bottle of my wife’s favorite wine. The associate working told us politely, that even though we are not allowed to bring our own wine, she would open it for us and pour us a glass…but wanted us to know the rules in case a manager showed up. She was great. The next morning at breakfast, I tried to order a Bloody Mary for my birthday breakfast…not caring that it was 9 a.m. I found out 2 things, #1, it’s called a Caesar in Canada, and #2, they don’t serve until 11.m. However, the waitress came back a few minutes later with a candle-topped chocolate cake slice with “Happy Birthday” written in decorative chocolate. That was wonderful. Then, the manager sent up a bottle of wine and some snacks to our room during the day with a Birthday card. We arrived back at our hotel to find this pleasant surprise. The Concierge was friendly, knowledgeable and happy-go-lucky. She helped us out with a lot of information and reservations. All in all, I would recommend this property to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Ontariogirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in September and overall I was very disappointed with the hotel and considering the price, I would have preferred to stay at the Pan Pacific or the Fairmont. Negatives: The bathroom door is basically a sliding closet door and ours actually had a shoe kick in it. The tub in our room did not drain properly, I ended up showering in another room. We tried to use the indoor pool and hot tub but didn't even get in. The pool looked as though it had not been cleaned, there was hair and debris floating on top. We went to use the hottub and there was a ring of dirt around the tub. When the jets started, it began foaming pretty bad. It was very gross and I was afraid of getting a skin infection if we had went in. The fan in the room was noisy and kept us awake most of the night and there was big gaps around the door that led from our room into the hall so we had light shining in all night too. Positive: The staff gave us free breakfast buffet for all of the inconvenience, which was nice, but the hotel was still a waste of money as far as I was concerned. Restaurant has a fantastic view. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: abenakee
Reviews.Content: Three wonderful days at the Renaissance Vancouver Hotel Harbourside. The view of the harbor from our room was outstanding and the maid service immpecable. Though a busy hotel, we never felt rushed or forgotten. The service from the front desk, concierge, diningroom and house staff was flawless. The bellman were very helpful with transportation and restaurant and sightseeing recommendations. The Renaissance should be on everyone's list when visiting Vancouver, a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views, but...”
Reviews.Author: Zaw50
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers beautiful views of the waterfront and the rooms are spacious and relatively modern. I found the staff to be less than friendly and not very accomodating, particluarly the staff in the restaurant. If traveling for business, this hotel is not a great option. Lack of a business center is problematic if you need to print anything. Hotel turned former business center into a small shop leaving guests forced to share two computers and one printer located in the lobby - which means you are often waiting on someone to finish checking email.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service and room quality poor”
Reviews.Author: MollyMolly
Reviews.Content: I've never been motivated to write a negative review of a hotel before, but if you are expecting minimal customer service and a decent room, don't stay at this hotel. When reviewers complained about outdated decor, that wasn't particularly worrisome, but I should have paid attention to previous complaints about poor customer service. Of far more of concern than the 80s-style decor, chaotic and insufficient lobby and the hot tub covered with a layer of scum, the customer service was nonexistent. Our room was dark with a slit of a window that looked out on the backs of bushes half a level up from our room, so it felt like we were in a basement. The beds were so crammed in that the desk chairs couldn't fit at the desks, so they were weirdly placed in the corners of the room. Free Internet was only available in the lobby, but when I took my laptop to the lobby, there were only a few occupied chairs and ottomans available to sit in -- I could sit in a chair in an otherwise empty lobby lounge, I was told, only if I bought a drink. Two different staff people told me "you can go sit on that ottoman" the only unoccupied space in a lobby which was always packed with people loading and unloading onto tour buses. I never saw the front lobby space without hundreds of pieces of tour luggage crammed in it. Since it was rumored that the hotel had views of the harbor, I took my laptop out onto the patio. There was a huge expanse of patio without chairs, and one area for restaurant patrons -- like the "free" Internet, if you wanted to enjoy the view, there was no option but to pay. To add insult to injury for this horrible stay, I had reserved via the Marriott web site and used a code to get a special rate. I had called the hotel directly to make sure they had the rate noted -- they didn't, but assured me they would. When I checked in, the front desk staff tried to charge me a different rate. When I asked them to look again, suddenly they found the note in the reservation. The entire place was run so unprofessionally, and the staff were so openly sullen and bored, I am shocked that this hotel is part of the Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: HappierTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre-cruise (out of Ballantyne) on points. We walked from the new Canada Line and was a little more of a hike than we thought, but if you are active, it should be fine. Checked in to find that we had a room with gorgeous view of harbor, Stanley Park and a little glimpse of the Lions Gate bridge. Loved the decor in eclectic reds, golds and blacks. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. Had the buffet breakfast in the morning and it was VERY good and the setting was so beautiful. We walked to Granville Island from here (quite a walk) and Stanley Park to rent bikes. Would stay here again in a heart beat! Great way to start a phenomenal vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great views of harbour”
Reviews.Author: WiMadcitytraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice with great view of harbour and float plane pier. Had a deck to sit out and eat or have a drink and close to boardwalk. Highly recommend, try and get a room with view of water.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: GibbsvilleGirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Renaissance and enjoyed our stay immensely. The friendly staff really add to the experience. They could not have been more helpful particularly the doormen/bell staff and the waiters and waitress in the restaurant. The rooms may be on the small side but are lovely with more then enough space for two adults. The large windows provided great views of the city. Most rooms have a sliding glass door with a Juliet balcony. We enjoyed the fresh air this provided but may have felt differently if traveling with small children. The location is perfect for touring this beautiful city - morning walks along the sea wall are wonderful. Plenty of options in the neighborhood for breakfast. Yes, the hotel restaurant is expensive but the dinner we had there was very good. The fitness center and pool area are also well-maintained and spacious. We did not experience any of the problems others mentioned with housekeeping. Our room was always spic & span clean and had a full supply of towels, shampoo, etc. Plenty of public transportation nearby and if you are a tourist the hop-on/hop-off bus stops right across the street. Enjoy your visit to beautiful BC.

Reviews.Title: “accessible rooms ok as long as you don't need much space”
Reviews.Author: april61997
Reviews.Content: was here for 3 nights mid- Aug. Great location. Expensive food  $23 plus for bacon and eggs??  Booked a 2 bedded assessible room and was told it was confirmed. When we got there I was informed it was either 2 dbl. beds with no assessiblity or 1 with a king bed and a chaise with assessiblity. I chose the king bed (I was with my 82 yr old mom and wheelchair bound sister. There is only enough room in the 'assessible' room to get the wheelchair in. Not enough room to get the chair around the room. The bathroom has grab bars at the toilet and in the shower/tub (if you need a roll in shower you are S.O.L)...Had to call twice for the extra bedding so I could sleep on the chaise . When I asked where a certain restrurant was I was told it just just a few blocks away (it was 8 blocks UP HILL and I was pushing a wheelchair).  You get 1 towel per person, some days we had shampoo/conditioner and lotion, other days we had no soap ,1 shampoo and 2 lotions. The bed  I was told was comfortable. I was woken up one night at 3am from the alarm clock in some other room. If you are not on the harbor side you get street noise till 2am.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: MN_GIS
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, We had an awesome view of the harbor, the room was perfectly sized. We had asked for a fridge and it was brought to the room in 10 minutes. The room was very quiet, never heard a single thing. The parking is very secure and you have in and out rights. The hotel is located in an excellent location. You can walk to Stanley Park and take the park shuttle, Robson, Gastown etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a four star, but you can see through all four sides of your door!”
Reviews.Author: JKMillerInc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this through priceline, thinking we'd be staying at a four star hotel. We were certainly impressed with the name, delighted by the deal and looked forward to the location. Upon arrival, the lobby was chaos with luggage strewn everywhere for a Coors Light/Maxim event...it felt like a frat house. Reception was chilly and the only time the desk clerk smiled was when she offered us a room with a water view for an extra $30 per night. Seriously? We went to our room to freshen up and were nonplussed. It was fine, but certainly not four star. The chaise lounge was stained, the desk was dusty and the bathroom was cramped at best. We took off to see the sights and returned later that evening to get ready for bed. Well...we didn't notice this during daylight hours, but upon closing our room door and dimming the lights, we noticed that we could see clearly into the hallway via spaces between the door and doorjamb. Not just light, but actual people passing by! On all four sides! If that wasn't enough, this also allowed quite a bit of sound to travel through to our room, and we heard every step, cough, door click, etc. all night long. We were SO disappointed! Good thing it was only one night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparky1978
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, the hotel is nice, clean and beautiful. I thought the service was excellent from the Concierge to the front desk. I work for Marriott and they didn't know it, but still went above and beyond. The fitness equipment could use some maintenance. I would definitely recommend eating breakfast and the Urban Market next door. Amazing omelets (plus potatoes and toast) for $10.00! We ate there everyday. You can also pick up sandwiches and snack items if you hit the hiking trails (Grouse Grind is a must if you want a workout).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice pool, but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: flycake99
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great view and is located in a continence location. The pool and gym are very nice. The room is not too spacious but it is still a good size. The bathroom is kind of small but at least it is clean. The parking is terrible and super expensive. The customer service is poor. Our bath tub didn’t drain very well the first night we stayed. We told the front desk in person and asked them to fix it the next morning. However, the bathtub still did not drain well the second night when we showered. Apparently they did not take care of the problem at all. I called the front desk about this problem again, but they told me there was no engineer stand by in the evening. However, we can just let the water over flow. I really felt sorry for the house keeper. This hotel really needs to improve their management. We got a good deal from Priceline so I was guessing that’s why we got a room with a bad tub. They definitely discriminate Priceline customers. Overall, the stay was not too bad for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: tikimermaid
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Renaissance. I had booked the hotel through Priceline and got a fantastic deal. When we arrived, I asked for a double room, as I was traveling with my husband and son. They were sold out but they offered me a bay view room on the top floor with an extra bed at no addtional charge. The view was absolutely fantastic. The room was generously sized and looked to be recently updated. The outside of the hotel looks a bit tired but the inside is lovely and the service is incredible. I would definitely stay there again. If you are going on a cruise, the terminal is within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, excellent place to be”
Reviews.Author: Sese74
Reviews.Content: High End Hotel with excellent service, great food and incredible view of the bay. It is located near the floatplane "airport", which doesn't cause any trouble due noise. The location of the hotel between Stanley Parc and Gastown makes the exploration of Vancouver Downtown easy, by bike or by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Enjoy Vancouver for Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SalesKing
Reviews.Content: The hotel was suggested to me by our Canadian Distributor. Upon check-in I noticed the Maxxim Coors Golf Modeling tryouts. Hundreds of beautiful girls vying for the opportunity to represent Maxxim and Coors were in a part of the lobby. Additionally, the hotel is located walking distance to the water and Stanley Park as well as other nightlife locales. It is also walking distance to the Convention Center where my distributor, colleagues and I participated in the Canadian Anesthesia Society Meeting; our main reason to be there. The Concierge Alex (female) is outstanding. I had an urgent medical need last Sunday and she coordinated the entire Medical Office Visit. She is great and is my hero who is a true asset for the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in a very good location - no frig”
Reviews.Author: worldgypse
Reviews.Content: Stayed using points. Very clean with very nice bedding. Great shower head. Surprising quiet for a hotel of this size. Very friendly/acknowlegeable staff. Free internet (not so typical for high end hotel which usually charges for internet). Only negative is no refrigerator in room. Good location to Stanley Park, Grouse Mountain, and other downtown activities. Parking for a fee ($26 for 24hrs self park, slightly more fo valet)

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel - good location but past its prime”
Reviews.Author: jbtexas
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Renaissance on a recent vacation in Vancouver. Overall, we had a good experience at the hotel, but could not quite get past some of the hotel's quirks. We ended up in a harbour view room. This after an intervention by a very helpful bellman, who asked my wife how our stay was shortly after we checked in and were "upgraded" to a city view room to be given a king size bed. Note that the harbour view room also had a king size bed. The harbour views are excellent - or at least were from our room. It appeared that the high rise condo across the street could block views from some rooms. There are two sets of sliding glass doors which both allow you to open the windows and / or block out the seaplane noise. With the windows closed, the room is very quiet. The room itself - as noted on other reviews - is quite small. The closet area is not very deep. Hang a shirt or jacket on a hanger in the closet and you'll have to turn it sideways to close the closet door. There is a very modern set up for accessing the internet and displaying your PC on the flat screen TV in the room. We did not try this set up. Internet access in the room costs $16 CDN per day. The bathrooms were small, and the light switch was a bit of a reach around the corner on the outside of the room, if you forgot to turn on the light before entering. The bathroom servicing was one of the quirks. Most hotels will leave 3-4 bath towels for a room with two guests. Consistently we were left only two towels. I don't know if this was conservation, hotel cost saving measures or just a quirk of the cleaning staff on our floor. The biggest quirk by far is the elevator system in the hotel. The doors close very quickly and on arrival, I actually rode the elevator up and back down and up again from the parking garage as by time my wife got off the elevator, the doors closed before I could get off. As noted in prior dated reviews, a room key is needed to operate the elevators to guest floors. I had several interesting experiences as the elevator began moving before guests could punch the button for their floor. There is a very large pool / fitness center area on the fourth floor. This would definitely be one of the pluses of the hotel. Upon check in, no recognition was given of the fact that I was Marriott Rewards Silver Elite status. Given the large number of tour groups staying here, I would have to think that not many Elite members stay here, although I may be wrong. At any rate, I was not made to feel welcome or in any way special because I was elite. This was in contrast to the helpful bellman, who was very specific in his recognition of our elite status (different marking on room key). The hotel's parking garage is a maize of underground twists and turns, including a few blind turns. Should you self park, drive slowly and carefully. Also, it is easier to turn right out of the exit onto Cordova than following the main signs to exit onto Hastings. In light of recent notoriety about gang crime in Vancouver, I would say that the hotel is in what appears to be a good location. A three minute walk will take one to the Seaside bike and walking / jogging trail which extends around Vancouver's beautiful waterfront and includes the walk around the seaside perimeter of Stanley Park. I did the walk from the hotel, around Stanley Park and back via Denman in two and a quarter hours. There are suggested nine and four mile walking / jogging routes on business card sized cards available in the fitness center. Going east from the hotel, it is a short walk to Canada Place, the new convention centre, and Burrard St. Burrard Street is where to go to get most city buses. The Skytrain can be boarded at the Waterfront Station opposite Canada Place. Tip: if you want a Translink day pass, they are sold in the city's visitor information centre opposite Canada Place (the place listed on the Translink web site in the 1000 block of West Hastings as selling transit passes did not sell day passes - at least not the day we tried to buy them there). The appearance of the hotel from the outside is definitely showing signs of age - but that may be in part due to the contrast to the newness of the hotels and condos surrounding the hotel. On the whole, we had a good stay, but on the whole I would most likely choose another hotel on my next visit to Vancouver. And I do want to acknowledge that despite some issues with service (towels, check-in), the helpful intervention of a great bellman really made our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: guienriquez
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed there one night after getting off an Alaska Cruise. It's very close to Canada Place where ships disembark, so we just walked about 5 minutes. The outside of the hotel looks discouraging, but once you go in you see that the hotel is very nice indeed. The rooms were very spacious and had a beautiful view of the harbour. The decor is bright, airy and modern without being to silly. There is not much happening on the harbour front area, but this is a good quiet location and you can walk to Robson or Davie streets in about 15minutes. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor physical plant and signs of high crime”
Reviews.Author: andrew02459
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three days midweek in mid May. As noted elsewhere the lobby and bar areas were under construction (not that we saw anything being done). The reg. desk was a tight fit for three employees but usually only two were there: long, long lines almost always for service. Given the lobby was large (think high school basketball court on two levels of marble) it was empty aside from a small bell captain station, the reg desk and the business area. It could be a full refit will address this but certainly whoever was in charge of interim planning should have allocated space better...this is one large hotel. The business centre area had two computers for guests..way insufficient for the hundreds of rooms in the hotel. The computer in the concierge lounge upstairs had to be "opened" by an employee..seemed really to be there for their use. All elevator trips had to be done with your room key activating the elevator and the rooms on the concierge floor where we were had large metal panels inserted covering the jamb where the latch was to prevent jimmying...made us very aware there must be some crime (papers there were calling Vancouver the new Columbia re: drug wars and gangs). The jacuzzi had hard blue mould growing on it and the lockers for the pool looked like veterans of a high school: most of them were well hammered, doors bent out of shape. There was a plentiful supply of new looking exercise machines. The actual room (again on the concierge floor) was quite small altho with a good view of the harbour. The hallways were done in a red/yellow/orange/black modern paint/carpet garish swirl...hard to take first thing mornings and just plain ugly at other times. The hotel seemed popular with Japanese families: loads of little kids running around. There was WiFi but it cost $16/day. This was more like a Courtyard than a Renaissance level Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soonie68
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel to stay at with wonderful rooms especially facing the harbour. Very nice beds with high quality linens and duvets. The restaurants are not great, but with so many great choics in the area, it doesn't matter. Nice lounge. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vancouver weekend bargain”
Reviews.Author: PlannerGeek
Reviews.Content: Spent a get-away weekend in Vancouver...as usual on weekend trips, we chose our hotel via Priceline, and once again had good luck. 3 1/2* and $65 got us the Renaisance Vancouver Harbourside. The Ren is an absolutely standard downtown business traveler hotel. Room was small but comfortable, very clean, quiet, and acceptible in every way. Not much character, but who cares, we weren't in Vancouver for the hotel. Parking is limited downtown...you can park yourself in the underground lot for CAN18 / day, which is CAN10 cheaper than at the hotel. Just keep going west on Hastings past the hotel, and the entrance is well marked at the end of the block. Overall, hotel location is good...it's in a stretch of hotels and office buildings along the waterfront, maybe 4-5 blocks from Robson shopping, and walkable to Gastown, Yaletown, and Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Expected A Little Better”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has a great central location, there were several drawbacks including very small rooms (especially the bathrooms) and construction in the lobby. The rooms appeared to be recently renovated but we found it to be very tight for two people. The bathroom fixtures were fine but nothing special. We did have a nice view of the water however. As mentioned, there was construction in the lobby and it was an uncomfortable place to work on the internet (to avoid the steep browsing fees in the rooms). The business center had one terminal that was occupied and the concierge floor lounge was closed over the weekend so it was a small hassle to do some work. ATM machine was also broken so we had to walk down the street. The health club is very spacious and has a nice pool and hot tub but the room still has a cicra 1970s feel. We didn't take advantage of the restaurant but it at least appeared to have a nice ambiance. We were also recommended a "romantic" restaurant by the front desk..not a bad place but it was packed with large, loud groups of drunken 20 somethings where you had to shout to be heard three feet away (confirmed by online reviews we unfortunately read after the fact). Otherwise service was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and incredible art!”
Reviews.Author: Alice_Springer
Reviews.Content: I travel a fair bit and am experientially weathered with the offerings of various hotels around North America in particular. I stayed at the Renaissance Vancouver and was initially put off that they were undergoing renovations to their lobby. However my chagrin soon changed when I was attended to chivalrously and promptly upon my arrival setting a standard that was maintained througout the entirety of my stay there last week. I spent a great deal of time at the entrance admiring the awe-inspiring art pieces that they have on the walls. I have never seen anything like the illuminated art work displayed. My inquiries revealed that Ron Sombilon, a local Artist, is the exhibitor. I commend wholeheartedly the Renaissance Vancouver for recognizing and nurturing their local talent. I will definitely make this hotel my first choice on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and location”
Reviews.Author: bab
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Comfortable bed. Very modern and well equiped fitness center. Staff attentive and willing to help you with anything. Ask for a room away from the elevators as thy are very noisy. Hotel well located for visits to Stanley park, the Aquarium, shopping(Robson street). Breakfeast is a little expensive as the parking and the internet access from the room. Overall, nice hotel with incredible views.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Remodel”
Reviews.Author: DaveFrancis
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel before, and found a few issues, but things have changed a bit....We stayed here with some friends during a long weekend and found the room upgrades to be very nice. Yes, it is the same hotel that now has a building blocking those wonderful harbour views, but it is still a great place to stay. We called while waiting at the border, and were given the internet price right away with no dickering. We were greeted at check in with the usual warmth we have always found at this hotel. The big suprise was the room remodels. They have done a nice job. I also think it is worth mentioning the restraunt downstairs. If you want a truly hassle free, great breakfast, thats the place. I usually stay clear of hotel eateries, but the staff and good food make it a real bargain....Kudos to you Marriott. You have dazzled me again...

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska
Reviews.Title: “Excellent chioce”
Reviews.Author: kevin_from_AKandCO
Reviews.Content: Great place. All staff we interacted with were welcoming and friendly. Room was beautifully decorated, modern, and very clean. Our visit started off nicely when we arrived at 10am, expecting to be able to just drop off our luggage until we could check in later. Without us asking, they quickly put us into a room. We had a great view of the city and the harbor, which made for nice viewing at sunset and sunrise. The location is great, as it is close to much of the action in Vancouver. Stanley Park is just a few minutes' walk away. Dinner at the restaurant was good, though like most hotel restaurants, pricey for what it was. A nice touch was the wheelchair the hotel has to loan guests (no charge), as my wife had just broken her ankle a week before. While the wheelchair was hardly top-notch, it did greatly increase our mobility. I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “loved the views, bedding is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jocelyn5911
Reviews.Content: this is a great, beautiful hotel with a great location. m husband and myself, with our teenage son, wanted a budget hotel with all the amentiees so when ama offered us the harbourside for 117.00 per night including all taxes we jumped for joy! this enabled us to have two rooms for all of us to enjoy and relax. ongoing pre-olympic renovations were a daily ocurance but did not disturb us at all. we were on a higher floor with unobstructed views coal harbor, walking distance to shopping and stanley park. we spent our mornings drinking coffee from room service watching the harbour planes landing and fed sea gulls from our balcony. the longest we waited for room service was 15 minutes, excellant by our standards. the staff sent up chocolate covered strawberries and a hand written note wishing u a happy 20th anniversary. the valets provided us with driving directions and ideas of things to see and do locally. i highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again. we travel to vancouver frquently for quick romantic week long getaways to escape the alberta snow.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Paulyester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to the harbour, shopping on Robson street and walking distance to Stanley Park. When we checked in we inquired about the fitness facilities as advertised on the web site. We were informed that they were closed for renovation but we could use the facilities at the Marriott accross the street. Had we known this in advance we would have booked our room at the Marriott. Our room was recently renovated, spacious and with a city view. We found the rate for parking to be a little pricey at $21 per day. We went down for breakfast and were seated quickly but ignored for almost ten minutes without being offered coffee. The breakfast buffet had limited selection and was overpriced. When I asked for a newspaper they informed I would have to go accross the street to get one at the gift shop in the Marriott. There are lots of choices of hotels in this price range in this area of Vancouver. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View on the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Dec 3, 2008. This is a nice Renaissance with harbor views. I booked a harbor view room and was given a lovely corner room on trhe 8th floor. While the hotel is not right on the water (there are a few condo buildings closer to the water) I was still able to have a nice view. The workout room was under repair during my stay, but they let guests use the Marriot workout room which is across the street. I can also see why this hotel is popular with cruises since the location is close to the terminal. I didn't eat on site, but do recommend Joe Fortes Seafood and Chop House. Vancouver is beautiful and I can't wait to return in January for my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Gem”
Reviews.Author: Carlanna
Reviews.Content: We initially booked a water view rate for 1 night directly with the Marriott reservation # as with Marriott I don't usually find a better rate with any of the web discounters. With AAA discount it was a decent rate for a good downtown hotel and we were only staying 1 night before leaving on a 22 night repositioning cruise to Asia. Because I get E-mails from Marriott Rewards a few weeks later they sent me an offer for the same hotel for a special renovation rate that was even less. I had read 1 negative review that said someone had stayed in a room that had not been renovated so I was sure to request that I be put in a room that was newly renovated just in case. The reservations agent explained for the renovation rate special I would not have a water view but that was OK with me since we would be on a cruise ship for 22 nights and would see plenty of water. When we checked in (prompt and efficient) and went to the room I was very pleasantly surprised to have a wonderful water view. In fact the next morning we were able to see several cruise ships on their way to the port. The room was newly renovated, bed very comfortable, very nice decor and nice toiletries . Housekeeping brought us extra pillows (standing request on my Marriott rewards account) and I remember calling for something like extra coffee and they brought it right away. We have stayed in many lower level hotels that included free internet and this would be the 1 downside as we had to pay for internet use in the business center. We did not choose the rate that included breakfast as it was pretty pricey. Instead that night we wandered into a nearby gourmet market that the concierge told us about and they had delicious looking baked goods . We purchased a scone and a muffin and some cream for coffee and ate in the room the next morning. We checked out and rolled our luggage to the nearby cruise port to embark on our cruise. I understand that not all cruise lines use this port so if port proximity is important to you then I would suggest verifying this before you book the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jkiel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in an ideal location for wandering around the harbour, with all the associated sights and sounds. The room we had was very comfortable, and since it was angled toward the street, we had a great view down the street towards many of the skyscrapers in Vancouver. Our only - not really a complaint, just an observation - is that the doors to the rooms are not as tight as in other Marriotts, which allowed some hallway noise into the room.

Reviews.Title: “If it's your romantic weekend away, don't book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: smallr
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a romantic evening away, don't book this hotel. I booked a room for my nephew, as a wedding gift. Despite having talked with the front desk twice, the latest being the morning of the wedding and making them aware that this was a wedding present and being assured that all would go smoothly for the couple, it did not. The front desk gave my nephew & his bride a hassle when they checked in. The clerk at the front desk was rude and the night Manager was even ruder.
